owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: Schema.org (converted to SHACL by TopQuadrant)
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment:
This is an experimental RDF/SHACL version of schema.org, generated based on the RDFa data model. Alignments with common RDF practices have been made, e.g. using rdfs:Class instead of schema:Class.

Contact: Holger Knublauch

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Postal address

sh:property.sh:name: addressLocality
sh:property.sh:description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

sh:property.sh:name: telephone
sh:property.sh:description: The telephone number.

sh:property.sh:name: event
sh:property.sh:description: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

sh:property.sh:name: doorTime
sh:property.sh:description: The time admission will commence.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Event

sh:property.sh:name: telephone
sh:property.sh:description: The telephone number.

sh:property.sh:name: awards
sh:property.sh:description: Awards won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: duns
sh:property.sh:description: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

sh:property.sh:name: event
sh:property.sh:description: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

sh:property.sh:name: logo
sh:property.sh:description: An associated logo.

sh:property.sh:name: hasPOS
sh:property.sh:description: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: areaServed
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

sh:property.sh:name: contactPoints
sh:property.sh:description: A contact point for a person or organization.

sh:property.sh:name: alumni
sh:property.sh:description: Alumni of an organization.

sh:property.sh:name: hasOfferCatalog
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfItems
sh:property.sh:description: The number of items in an ItemList. Note that some descriptions might not fully describe all items in a list (e.g., multi-page pagination); in such cases, the numberOfItems would be for the entire list.

sh:property.sh:name: description
sh:property.sh:description: A description of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: url
sh:property.sh:description: URL of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: additionalType
sh:property.sh:description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

sh:property.sh:name: identifier
sh:property.sh:description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: disambiguatingDescription
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The most generic type of item.
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Thing

sh:property.sh:name: potentialAction
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

sh:property.sh:name: mainEntityOfPage
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#mainEntityBackground) for details.

sh:property.sh:name: image
sh:property.sh:description: An image of the item. This can be a [[URL]] or a fully described [[ImageObject]].

sh:property.sh:name: name
sh:property.sh:description: The name of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: sameAs
sh:property.sh:description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

sh:property.sh:name: alternateName
sh:property.sh:description: An alias for the item.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Intangible
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Enumeration
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Lists or enumerations—for example, a list of cuisines or music genres, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Item list order type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Enumerated for values for itemListOrder for indicating how an ordered ItemList is organized.

sh:property.sh:name: itemListOrder
sh:property.sh:description: Type of ordering (e.g. Ascending, Descending, Unordered).

sh:property.sh:name: previousItem
sh:property.sh:description: A link to the ListItem that preceeds the current one.

sh:property.sh:name: position
sh:property.sh:description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

sh:property.sh:name: nextItem
sh:property.sh:description: A link to the ListItem that follows the current one.

sh:property.sh:name: item
sh:property.sh:description: An entity represented by an entry in a list or data feed (e.g. an 'artist' in a list of 'artists')’.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: List item
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An list item, e.g. a step in a checklist or how-to description.

sh:property.sh:name: itemListElement
sh:property.sh:description:
For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem.

Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists.

Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements. Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Item list
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Offer catalog
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An OfferCatalog is an ItemList that contains related Offers and/or further OfferCatalogs that are offeredBy the same provider.

sh:property.sh:name: children
sh:property.sh:description: A child of the person.

sh:property.sh:name: worksFor
sh:property.sh:description: Organizations that the person works for.

sh:property.sh:name: birthPlace
sh:property.sh:description: The place where the person was born.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Person

sh:property.sh:name: homeLocation
sh:property.sh:description: A contact location for a person's residence.

sh:property.sh:name: address
sh:property.sh:description: Physical address of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: contactPoints
sh:property.sh:description: A contact point for a person or organization.

sh:property.sh:name: taxID
sh:property.sh:description: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: validFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The date when the item becomes valid.

sh:property.sh:name: maxValue
sh:property.sh:description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Structured value
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Structured values are used when the value of a property has a more complex structure than simply being a textual value or a reference to another thing.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Monetary amount

sh:property.sh:name: currency
sh:property.sh:description: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed (in 3-letter [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) format).

sh:property.sh:name: validThrough
sh:property.sh:description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

sh:property.sh:name: minValue
sh:property.sh:description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

sh:property.sh:name: value
sh:property.sh:description:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.

sh:property.sh:name: netWorth
sh:property.sh:description: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

sh:property.sh:name: vatID
sh:property.sh:description: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: isicV4
sh:property.sh:description: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

sh:property.sh:name: publishingPrinciples
sh:property.sh:description:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].
While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

sh:property.sh:name: hasPOS
sh:property.sh:description: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: duns
sh:property.sh:description: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

sh:property.sh:name: affiliation
sh:property.sh:description: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

sh:property.sh:name: parents
sh:property.sh:description: A parents of the person.

sh:property.sh:name: memberOf
sh:property.sh:description: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Gender type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An enumeration of genders.

sh:property.sh:name: gender
sh:property.sh:description: Gender of the person. While http://schema.org/Male and http://schema.org/Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender.

sh:property.sh:name: givenName
sh:property.sh:description: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

sh:property.sh:name: jobTitle
sh:property.sh:description: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

sh:property.sh:name: funder
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

sh:property.sh:name: honorificSuffix
sh:property.sh:description: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

sh:property.sh:name: sponsor
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

sh:property.sh:name: review
sh:property.sh:description: A review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: reviewRating
sh:property.sh:description: The rating given in this review. Note that reviews can themselves be rated. The ```reviewRating``` applies to rating given by the review. The [[aggregateRating]] property applies to the review itself, as a creative work.

sh:property.sh:name: worstRating
sh:property.sh:description: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.

sh:property.sh:name: ratingValue
sh:property.sh:description: The rating for the content.

sh:property.sh:name: bestRating
sh:property.sh:description: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.

sh:property.sh:name: author
sh:property.sh:description: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Rating
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A rating is an evaluation on a numeric scale, such as 1 to 5 stars.

sh:property.sh:name: reviewBody
sh:property.sh:description: The actual body of the review.

sh:property.sh:name: itemReviewed
sh:property.sh:description: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Review
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

sh:property.sh:name: logo
sh:property.sh:description: An associated logo.

sh:property.sh:name: aggregateRating
sh:property.sh:description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: reviewCount
sh:property.sh:description: The count of total number of reviews.

sh:property.sh:name: ratingCount
sh:property.sh:description: The count of total number of ratings.

sh:property.sh:name: itemReviewed
sh:property.sh:description: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Aggregate rating
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The average rating based on multiple ratings or reviews.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Brand
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A brand is a name used by an organization or business person for labeling a product, product group, or similar.

sh:property.sh:name: brand
sh:property.sh:description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

sh:property.sh:name: height
sh:property.sh:description: The height of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: award
sh:property.sh:description: An award won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: alumni
sh:property.sh:description: Alumni of an organization.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Educational organization
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An educational organization.

sh:property.sh:name: alumniOf
sh:property.sh:description: An organization that the person is an alumni of.

sh:property.sh:name: faxNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The fax number.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

sh:property.sh:name: deathPlace
sh:property.sh:description: The place where the person died.

sh:property.sh:name: telephone
sh:property.sh:description: The telephone number.

sh:property.sh:name: seeks
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

sh:property.sh:name: parent
sh:property.sh:description: A parent of this person.

sh:property.sh:name: spouse
sh:property.sh:description: The person's spouse.

sh:property.sh:name: relatedTo
sh:property.sh:description: The most generic familial relation.

sh:property.sh:name: honorificPrefix
sh:property.sh:description: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

sh:property.sh:name: makesOffer
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: colleagues
sh:property.sh:description: A colleague of the person.

sh:property.sh:name: offers
sh:property.sh:description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin13
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-13](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-13.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: releaseDate
sh:property.sh:description: The release date of a product or product model. This can be used to distinguish the exact variant of a product.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin14
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-14](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-14.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: width
sh:property.sh:description: The width of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: productionDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

sh:property.sh:name: additionalProperty
sh:property.sh:description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

sh:property.sh:name: isSimilarTo
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

sh:property.sh:name: mpn
sh:property.sh:description: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

sh:property.sh:name: manufacturer
sh:property.sh:description: The manufacturer of the product.

sh:property.sh:name: brand
sh:property.sh:description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

sh:property.sh:name: isConsumableFor
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is a consumable.

sh:property.sh:name: isRelatedTo
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

sh:property.sh:name: aggregateRating
sh:property.sh:description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin8
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-8](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-8.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin12
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-12](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-12.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: category
sh:property.sh:description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

sh:property.sh:name: itemCondition
sh:property.sh:description: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Offer item condition
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A list of possible conditions for the item.

sh:property.sh:name: color
sh:property.sh:description: The color of the product.

sh:property.sh:name: purchaseDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

sh:property.sh:name: reviews
sh:property.sh:description: Review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: review
sh:property.sh:description: A review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: isAccessoryOrSparePartFor
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is an accessory or spare part.

sh:property.sh:name: productID
sh:property.sh:description: The product identifier, such as ISBN. For example: ``` meta itemprop="productID" content="isbn:123-456-789" ```.

sh:property.sh:name: height
sh:property.sh:description: The height of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: depth
sh:property.sh:description: The depth of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: awards
sh:property.sh:description: Awards won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: award
sh:property.sh:description: An award won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: logo
sh:property.sh:description: An associated logo.

sh:property.sh:name: material
sh:property.sh:description: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

sh:property.sh:name: sku
sh:property.sh:description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

sh:property.sh:name: successorOf
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer from a newer variant of a product to its previous, often discontinued predecessor.

sh:property.sh:name: predecessorOf
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer from a previous, often discontinued variant of the product to its newer variant.

sh:property.sh:name: isVariantOf
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to a base product from which this product is a variant. It is safe to infer that the variant inherits all product features from the base model, unless defined locally. This is not transitive.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Product model
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A datasheet or vendor specification of a product (in the sense of a prototypical description).

sh:property.sh:name: model
sh:property.sh:description: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

sh:property.sh:name: audience
sh:property.sh:description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

sh:property.sh:name: geographicArea
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area associated with the audience.

sh:property.sh:name: audienceType
sh:property.sh:description: The target group associated with a given audience (e.g. veterans, car owners, musicians, etc.).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Audience
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

sh:property.sh:name: weight
sh:property.sh:description: The weight of the product or person.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Product

sh:property.sh:name: typeOfGood
sh:property.sh:description: The product that this structured value is referring to.

sh:property.sh:name: ownedThrough
sh:property.sh:description: The date and time of giving up ownership on the product.

sh:property.sh:name: ownedFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The date and time of obtaining the product.

sh:property.sh:name: acquiredFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Ownership info
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A structured value providing information about when a certain organization or person owned a certain product.

sh:property.sh:name: owns
sh:property.sh:description: Products owned by the organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: weight
sh:property.sh:description: The weight of the product or person.

sh:property.sh:name: knows
sh:property.sh:description: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.

sh:property.sh:name: contactPoint
sh:property.sh:description: A contact point for a person or organization.

sh:property.sh:name: awards
sh:property.sh:description: Awards won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: sibling
sh:property.sh:description: A sibling of the person.

sh:property.sh:name: globalLocationNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

sh:property.sh:name: birthDate
sh:property.sh:description: Date of birth.

sh:property.sh:name: email
sh:property.sh:description: Email address.

sh:property.sh:name: workLocation
sh:property.sh:description: A contact location for a person's place of work.

sh:property.sh:name: nationality
sh:property.sh:description: Nationality of the person.

sh:property.sh:name: colleague
sh:property.sh:description: A colleague of the person.

sh:property.sh:name: additionalName
sh:property.sh:description: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

sh:property.sh:name: naics
sh:property.sh:description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

sh:property.sh:name: siblings
sh:property.sh:description: A sibling of the person.

sh:property.sh:name: follows
sh:property.sh:description: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

sh:property.sh:name: deathDate
sh:property.sh:description: Date of death.

sh:property.sh:name: performerIn
sh:property.sh:description: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.

sh:property.sh:name: familyName
sh:property.sh:description: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

sh:property.sh:name: address
sh:property.sh:description: Physical address of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: members
sh:property.sh:description: A member of this organization.

sh:property.sh:name: hasOfferCatalog
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

sh:property.sh:name: vatID
sh:property.sh:description: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: founders
sh:property.sh:description: A person who founded this organization.

sh:property.sh:name: memberOf
sh:property.sh:description: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

sh:property.sh:name: founder
sh:property.sh:description: A person who founded this organization.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Organization

sh:property.sh:name: taxID
sh:property.sh:description: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

sh:property.sh:name: sponsor
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

sh:property.sh:name: serviceArea
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where the service is provided.

sh:property.sh:name: naics
sh:property.sh:description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

sh:property.sh:name: parentOrganization
sh:property.sh:description: The larger organization that this organization is a [[subOrganization]] of, if any.

sh:property.sh:name: dissolutionDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date that this organization was dissolved.

sh:property.sh:name: employee
sh:property.sh:description: Someone working for this organization.

sh:property.sh:name: reviews
sh:property.sh:description: Review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: funder
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

sh:property.sh:name: leiCode
sh:property.sh:description: An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.

sh:property.sh:name: subOrganization
sh:property.sh:description: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property.

sh:property.sh:name: brand
sh:property.sh:description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

sh:property.sh:name: aggregateRating
sh:property.sh:description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: faxNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The fax number.

sh:property.sh:name: seeks
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

sh:property.sh:name: email
sh:property.sh:description: Email address.

sh:property.sh:name: publishingPrinciples
sh:property.sh:description:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].
While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

sh:property.sh:name: contactPoint
sh:property.sh:description: A contact point for a person or organization.

sh:property.sh:name: events
sh:property.sh:description: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

sh:property.sh:name: isicV4
sh:property.sh:description: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

sh:property.sh:name: member
sh:property.sh:description: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

sh:property.sh:name: globalLocationNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: foundingDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date that this organization was founded.

sh:property.sh:name: employees
sh:property.sh:description: People working for this organization.

sh:property.sh:name: review
sh:property.sh:description: A review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfEmployees
sh:property.sh:description: The number of employees in an organization e.g. business.

sh:property.sh:name: award
sh:property.sh:description: An award won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: legalName
sh:property.sh:description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

sh:property.sh:name: location
sh:property.sh:description: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

sh:property.sh:name: foundingLocation
sh:property.sh:description: The place where the Organization was founded.

sh:property.sh:name: owns
sh:property.sh:description: Products owned by the organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: makesOffer
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: department
sh:property.sh:description: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

sh:property.sh:name: attendee
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization attending the event.

sh:property.sh:name: recordedIn
sh:property.sh:description: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.

sh:property.sh:name: contributor
sh:property.sh:description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

sh:property.sh:name: isAccessibleForFree
sh:property.sh:description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

sh:property.sh:name: typicalAgeRange
sh:property.sh:description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

sh:property.sh:name: remainingAttendeeCapacity
sh:property.sh:description: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.

sh:property.sh:name: about
sh:property.sh:description: The subject matter of the content.

sh:property.sh:name: composer
sh:property.sh:description: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

sh:property.sh:name: endDate
sh:property.sh:description: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:property.sh:name: duration
sh:property.sh:description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

sh:property.sh:name: subEvents
sh:property.sh:description: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each subEvents of the conference.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Language
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in [BCP 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) can be used via the [[alternateName]] property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using [[ComputerLanguage]].

sh:property.sh:name: inLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

sh:property.sh:name: funder
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

sh:property.sh:name: previousStartDate
sh:property.sh:description: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

sh:property.sh:name: subEvent
sh:property.sh:description: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.

sh:property.sh:name: startDate
sh:property.sh:description: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: audience
sh:property.sh:description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

sh:property.sh:name: review
sh:property.sh:description: A review of the item.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the [[offers]] property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

sh:property.sh:name: workPerformed
sh:property.sh:description: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

sh:property.sh:name: attendees
sh:property.sh:description: A person attending the event.

sh:property.sh:name: organizer
sh:property.sh:description: An organizer of an Event.

sh:property.sh:name: aggregateRating
sh:property.sh:description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: performers
sh:property.sh:description: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.

sh:property.sh:name: sponsor
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

sh:property.sh:name: workFeatured
sh:property.sh:description: A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent. Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).

sh:property.sh:name: performer
sh:property.sh:description: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

sh:property.sh:name: translator
sh:property.sh:description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

sh:property.sh:name: offers
sh:property.sh:description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

sh:property.sh:name: eventStatus
sh:property.sh:description: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Event status type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: EventStatusType is an enumeration type whose instances represent several states that an Event may be in.

sh:property.sh:name: location
sh:property.sh:description: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: maximumAttendeeCapacity
sh:property.sh:description: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

sh:property.sh:name: superEvent
sh:property.sh:description: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

sh:property.sh:name: events
sh:property.sh:description: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Place

sh:property.sh:name: specialOpeningHoursSpecification
sh:property.sh:description: The special opening hours of a certain place.\n\nUse this to explicitly override general opening hours brought in scope by [[openingHoursSpecification]] or [[openingHours]].

sh:property.sh:name: mapType
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates the kind of Map, from the MapCategoryType Enumeration.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Map category type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An enumeration of several kinds of Map.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Map
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A map.

sh:property.sh:name: hasMap
sh:property.sh:description: A URL to a map of the place.

sh:property.sh:name: openingHoursSpecification
sh:property.sh:description: The opening hours of a certain place.

sh:property.sh:name: maps
sh:property.sh:description: A URL to a map of the place.

sh:property.sh:name: branchCode
sh:property.sh:description: A short textual code (also called "store code") that uniquely identifies a place of business. The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs.\n\nFor example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Photograph
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A photograph.

sh:property.sh:name: photo
sh:property.sh:description: A photograph of this place.

sh:property.sh:name: photos
sh:property.sh:description: Photographs of this place.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

sh:property.sh:name: globalLocationNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

sh:property.sh:name: containsPlace
sh:property.sh:description: The basic containment relation between a place and another that it contains.

sh:property.sh:name: containedIn
sh:property.sh:description: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

sh:property.sh:name: amenityFeature
sh:property.sh:description: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

sh:property.sh:name: validThrough
sh:property.sh:description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

sh:property.sh:name: validFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The date when the item becomes valid.

sh:property.sh:name: hoursAvailable
sh:property.sh:description: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Location feature specification
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Specifies a location feature by providing a structured value representing a feature of an accommodation as a property-value pair of varying degrees of formality.

sh:property.sh:name: maximumAttendeeCapacity
sh:property.sh:description: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

sh:property.sh:name: geo
sh:property.sh:description: The geo coordinates of the place.

sh:property.sh:name: additionalProperty
sh:property.sh:description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

sh:property.sh:name: isAccessibleForFree
sh:property.sh:description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

sh:property.sh:name: reviews
sh:property.sh:description: Review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: logo
sh:property.sh:description: An associated logo.

sh:property.sh:name: aggregateRating
sh:property.sh:description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: review
sh:property.sh:description: A review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: address
sh:property.sh:description: Physical address of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: publicAccess
sh:property.sh:description: A flag to signal that the [[Place]] is open to public visitors. If this property is omitted there is no assumed default boolean value

sh:property.sh:name: isicV4
sh:property.sh:description: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

sh:property.sh:name: containedInPlace
sh:property.sh:description: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

sh:property.sh:name: smokingAllowed
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates whether it is allowed to smoke in the place, e.g. in the restaurant, hotel or hotel room.

sh:property.sh:name: faxNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The fax number.

sh:property.sh:name: map
sh:property.sh:description: A URL to a map of the place.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Administrative area
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Country
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A country.

sh:property.sh:name: addressCountry
sh:property.sh:description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

sh:property.sh:name: postOfficeBoxNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

sh:property.sh:name: addressRegion
sh:property.sh:description: The region. For example, CA.

sh:property.sh:name: streetAddress
sh:property.sh:description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The mailing address.

sh:property.sh:name: postalCode
sh:property.sh:description: The postal code. For example, 94043.

sh:property.sh:name: address
sh:property.sh:description: Physical address of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: box
sh:property.sh:description: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character.

sh:property.sh:name: line
sh:property.sh:description: A line is a point-to-point path consisting of two or more points. A line is expressed as a series of two or more point objects separated by space.

sh:property.sh:name: circle
sh:property.sh:description: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Geo shape

sh:property.sh:name: postalCode
sh:property.sh:description: The postal code. For example, 94043.

sh:property.sh:name: elevation
sh:property.sh:description: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

sh:property.sh:name: polygon
sh:property.sh:description: A polygon is the area enclosed by a point-to-point path for which the starting and ending points are the same. A polygon is expressed as a series of four or more space delimited points where the first and final points are identical.

sh:property.sh:name: addressCountry
sh:property.sh:description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The geographic shape of a place. A GeoShape can be described using several properties whose values are based on latitude/longitude pairs. Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.
Used to describe membership in a loyalty programs (e.g. "StarAliance"), traveler clubs (e.g. "AAA"), purchase clubs ("Safeway Club"), etc.

sh:property.sh:name: programName
sh:property.sh:description: The program providing the membership.

sh:property.sh:name: membershipNumber
sh:property.sh:description: A unique identifier for the membership.

sh:property.sh:name: member
sh:property.sh:description: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

sh:property.sh:name: members
sh:property.sh:description: A member of this organization.

sh:property.sh:name: hostingOrganization
sh:property.sh:description: The organization (airline, travelers' club, etc.) the membership is made with.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Program membership

sh:property.sh:name: validFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The date when the item becomes valid.

sh:property.sh:name: opens
sh:property.sh:description: The opening hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

sh:property.sh:name: dayOfWeek
sh:property.sh:description: The day of the week for which these opening hours are valid.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Day of week
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
The day of the week, e.g. used to specify to which day the opening hours of an OpeningHoursSpecification refer.
Originally, URLs from [GoodRelations](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1) were used (for [[Monday]], [[Tuesday]], [[Wednesday]], [[Thursday]], [[Friday]], [[Saturday]], [[Sunday]] plus a special entry for [[PublicHolidays]]); these have now been integrated directly into schema.org.

sh:property.sh:name: closes
sh:property.sh:description: The closing hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

sh:property.sh:name: validThrough
sh:property.sh:description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.

 The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Opening hours specification

sh:property.sh:name: lyricist
sh:property.sh:description: The person who wrote the words.

sh:property.sh:name: musicArrangement
sh:property.sh:description: An arrangement derived from the composition.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Music composition

sh:property.sh:name: iswcCode
sh:property.sh:description: The International Standard Musical Work Code for the composition.

sh:property.sh:name: includedComposition
sh:property.sh:description: Smaller compositions included in this work (e.g. a movement in a symphony).

sh:property.sh:name: recordedAs
sh:property.sh:description: An audio recording of the work.

sh:property.sh:name: recordingOf
sh:property.sh:description: The composition this track is a recording of.

sh:property.sh:name: isrcCode
sh:property.sh:description: The International Standard Recording Code for the recording.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Music recording

sh:property.sh:name: duration
sh:property.sh:description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

sh:property.sh:name: byArtist
sh:property.sh:description: The artist that performed this album or recording.

sh:property.sh:name: inAlbum
sh:property.sh:description: The album to which this recording belongs.

sh:property.sh:name: byArtist
sh:property.sh:description: The artist that performed this album or recording.

sh:property.sh:name: albumReleaseType
sh:property.sh:description: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Music album release type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

sh:property.sh:name: albumRelease
sh:property.sh:description: A release of this album.

sh:property.sh:name: catalogNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The catalog number for the release.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A MusicRelease is a specific release of a music album.

sh:property.sh:name: musicReleaseFormat
sh:property.sh:description: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, ie. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Music release format type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, ie. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

sh:property.sh:name: recordLabel
sh:property.sh:description: The label that issued the release.

sh:property.sh:name: tracks
sh:property.sh:description: A music recording (track)—usually a single song.

sh:property.sh:name: track
sh:property.sh:description: A music recording (track)—usually a single song. If an ItemList is given, the list should contain items of type MusicRecording.

sh:property.sh:name: numTracks
sh:property.sh:description: The number of tracks in this album or playlist.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Music playlist
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A collection of music tracks in playlist form.

sh:property.sh:name: duration
sh:property.sh:description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

sh:property.sh:name: releaseOf
sh:property.sh:description: The album this is a release of.

sh:property.sh:name: creditedTo
sh:property.sh:description: The group the release is credited to if different than the byArtist. For example, Red and Blue is credited to "Stefani Germanotta Band", but by Lady Gaga.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Music release

sh:property.sh:name: albumProductionType
sh:property.sh:description: Classification of the album by it's type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Music album production type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Classification of the album by it's type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Music album
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A collection of music tracks.

sh:property.sh:name: inPlaylist
sh:property.sh:description: The playlist to which this recording belongs.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A music recording (track), usually a single song.

sh:property.sh:name: musicalKey
sh:property.sh:description: The key, mode, or scale this composition uses.

sh:property.sh:name: lyrics
sh:property.sh:description: The words in the song.

sh:property.sh:name: firstPerformance
sh:property.sh:description: The date and place the work was first performed.

sh:property.sh:name: composer
sh:property.sh:description: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A musical composition.

sh:property.sh:name: musicCompositionForm
sh:property.sh:description: The type of composition (e.g. overture, sonata, symphony, etc.).

sh:property.sh:name: artEdition
sh:property.sh:description: The number of copies when multiple copies of a piece of artwork are produced - e.g. for a limited edition of 20 prints, 'artEdition' refers to the total number of copies (in this example "20").

sh:property.sh:name: depth
sh:property.sh:description: The depth of the item.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A work of art that is primarily visual in character.

sh:property.sh:name: artMedium
sh:property.sh:description: The material used. (e.g. Oil, Watercolour, Acrylic, Linoprint, Marble, Cyanotype, Digital, Lithograph, DryPoint, Intaglio, Pastel, Woodcut, Pencil, Mixed Media, etc.)

sh:property.sh:name: height
sh:property.sh:description: The height of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: artform
sh:property.sh:description: e.g. Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Print, Photograph, Assemblage, Collage, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: surface
sh:property.sh:description: A material used as a surface in some artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Visual artwork

sh:property.sh:name: width
sh:property.sh:description: The width of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: artworkSurface
sh:property.sh:description: The supporting materials for the artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfPreviousOwners
sh:property.sh:description: The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfForwardGears
sh:property.sh:description: The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleSpecialUsage
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi. The legislation in many countries requires this information to be revealed when offering a car for sale.

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleInteriorType
sh:property.sh:description: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleInteriorColor
sh:property.sh:description: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

sh:property.sh:name: lesserOrEqual
sh:property.sh:description: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than or equal to the object.

sh:property.sh:name: nonEqual
sh:property.sh:description: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is not equal to the object.

sh:property.sh:name: additionalProperty
sh:property.sh:description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

sh:property.sh:name: greater
sh:property.sh:description: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than the object.

sh:property.sh:name: valueReference
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

sh:property.sh:name: equal
sh:property.sh:description: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is equal to the object.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A predefined value for a product characteristic, e.g. the power cord plug type 'US' or the garment sizes 'S', 'M', 'L', and 'XL'.
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Qualitative value

sh:property.sh:name: lesser
sh:property.sh:description: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than the object.

sh:property.sh:name: greaterOrEqual
sh:property.sh:description: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than or equal to the object.

sh:property.sh:name: fuelType
sh:property.sh:description: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleModelDate
sh:property.sh:description: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleEngine
sh:property.sh:description: Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.

sh:property.sh:name: fuelType
sh:property.sh:description: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Engine specification
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Information about the engine of the vehicle. A vehicle can have multiple engines represented by multiple engine specification entities.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Vehicle

sh:property.sh:name: steeringPosition
sh:property.sh:description: The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Steering position value
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A value indicating a steering position.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfAxles
sh:property.sh:description: The number of axles.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

sh:property.sh:name: fuelEfficiency
sh:property.sh:description:
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).

* Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter. Use [[unitText]] to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L.
* Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, [[fuelConsumption]] (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and [[fuelEfficiency]] (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
* Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use [[valueReference]] to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleTransmission
sh:property.sh:description: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleIdentificationNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

sh:property.sh:name: dateVehicleFirstRegistered
sh:property.sh:description: The date of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A vehicle is a device that is designed or used to transport people or cargo over land, water, air, or through space.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfDoors
sh:property.sh:description: The number of doors.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfAirbags
sh:property.sh:description: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleConfiguration
sh:property.sh:description: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

sh:property.sh:name: purchaseDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

sh:property.sh:name: mileageFromOdometer
sh:property.sh:description: The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.\n\nTypical unit code(s): KMT for kilometers, SMI for statute miles

sh:property.sh:name: knownVehicleDamages
sh:property.sh:description: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

sh:property.sh:name: fuelConsumption
sh:property.sh:description:
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).

* Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km. Use [[unitText]] to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km.
* Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, [[fuelConsumption]] (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and [[fuelEfficiency]] (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
* Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use [[valueReference]] to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.

sh:property.sh:name: productionDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

sh:property.sh:name: cargoVolume
sh:property.sh:description:
The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

Typical unit code(s): LTR for liters, FTQ for cubic foot/feet

Note: You can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Drive wheel configuration value
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A value indicating which roadwheels will receive torque.

sh:property.sh:name: driveWheelConfiguration
sh:property.sh:description: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.

sh:property.sh:name: vehicleSeatingCapacity
sh:property.sh:description: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

sh:property.sh:name: unitCode
sh:property.sh:description: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

sh:property.sh:name: value
sh:property.sh:description:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.

sh:property.sh:name: minValue
sh:property.sh:description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

sh:property.sh:name: valueReference
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

sh:property.sh:name: propertyID
sh:property.sh:description: A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be (1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific id of the property), or (3) a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry). Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Property value
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.\n\n Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

sh:property.sh:name: unitText
sh:property.sh:description: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

sh:property.sh:name: maxValue
sh:property.sh:description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Image object

sh:property.sh:name: representativeOfPage
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates whether this image is representative of the content of the page.

sh:property.sh:name: exifData
sh:property.sh:description: exif data for this object.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An image file.

sh:property.sh:name: caption
sh:property.sh:description: The caption for this object.

sh:property.sh:name: thumbnail
sh:property.sh:description: Thumbnail image for an image or video.

sh:property.sh:name: providerMobility
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates the mobility of a provided service (e.g. 'static', 'dynamic').

sh:property.sh:name: serviceAudience
sh:property.sh:description: The audience eligible for this service.

sh:property.sh:name: broker
sh:property.sh:description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller. In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange. If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

sh:property.sh:name: award
sh:property.sh:description: An award won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: areaServed
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

sh:property.sh:name: serviceArea
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where the service is provided.

sh:property.sh:name: isSimilarTo
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

sh:property.sh:name: isRelatedTo
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

sh:property.sh:name: serviceOutput
sh:property.sh:description: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: review
sh:property.sh:description: A review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: aggregateRating
sh:property.sh:description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: availableChannel
sh:property.sh:description: A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).

sh:property.sh:name: audience
sh:property.sh:description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

sh:property.sh:name: hoursAvailable
sh:property.sh:description: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

sh:property.sh:name: brand
sh:property.sh:description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Service

sh:property.sh:name: produces
sh:property.sh:description: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: hasOfferCatalog
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

sh:property.sh:name: serviceType
sh:property.sh:description: The type of service being offered, e.g. veterans' benefits, emergency relief, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: provider
sh:property.sh:description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

sh:property.sh:name: offers
sh:property.sh:description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

sh:property.sh:name: logo
sh:property.sh:description: An associated logo.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: category
sh:property.sh:description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

sh:property.sh:name: serviceUrl
sh:property.sh:description: The website to access the service.

sh:property.sh:name: serviceSmsNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The number to access the service by text message.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Service channel

sh:property.sh:name: availableLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

sh:property.sh:name: providesService
sh:property.sh:description: The service provided by this channel.

sh:property.sh:name: servicePostalAddress
sh:property.sh:description: The address for accessing the service by mail.

sh:property.sh:name: serviceLocation
sh:property.sh:description: The location (e.g. civic structure, local business, etc.) where a person can go to access the service.

sh:property.sh:name: processingTime
sh:property.sh:description: Estimated processing time for the service using this channel.

sh:property.sh:name: servicePhone
sh:property.sh:description: The phone number to use to access the service.

sh:property.sh:name: deliveryStatus
sh:property.sh:description: New entry added as the package passes through each leg of its journey (from shipment to final delivery).

sh:property.sh:name: hasDeliveryMethod
sh:property.sh:description: Method used for delivery or shipping.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Delivery method
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A delivery method is a standardized procedure for transferring the product or service to the destination of fulfillment chosen by the customer. Delivery methods are characterized by the means of transportation used, and by the organization or group that is the contracting party for the sending organization or person.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeDirectDownload
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeFreight
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeMail
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeOwnFleet
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModePickUp
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DHL
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#FederalExpress
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#UPS

sh:property.sh:name: availableThrough
sh:property.sh:description: After this date, the item will no longer be available for pickup.

sh:property.sh:name: availableFrom
sh:property.sh:description: When the item is available for pickup from the store, locker, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: accessCode
sh:property.sh:description: Password, PIN, or access code needed for delivery (e.g. from a locker).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Delivery event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An event involving the delivery of an item.

sh:property.sh:name: carrier
sh:property.sh:description: 'carrier' is an out-dated term indicating the 'provider' for parcel delivery and flights.

sh:property.sh:name: provider
sh:property.sh:description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

sh:property.sh:name: originAddress
sh:property.sh:description: Shipper's address.

sh:property.sh:name: deliveryAddress
sh:property.sh:description: Destination address.

sh:property.sh:name: trackingUrl
sh:property.sh:description: Tracking url for the parcel delivery.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Parcel delivery

sh:property.sh:name: trackingNumber
sh:property.sh:description: Shipper tracking number.

sh:property.sh:name: itemShipped
sh:property.sh:description: Item(s) being shipped.

sh:property.sh:name: expectedArrivalFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The earliest date the package may arrive.

sh:property.sh:name: expectedArrivalUntil
sh:property.sh:description: The latest date the package may arrive.

sh:property.sh:name: partOfOrder
sh:property.sh:description: The overall order the items in this delivery were included in.

sh:property.sh:name: hasDeliveryMethod
sh:property.sh:description: Method used for delivery or shipping.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The delivery of a parcel either via the postal service or a commercial service.

sh:property.sh:name: petsAllowed
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

sh:property.sh:name: permittedUsage
sh:property.sh:description: Indications regarding the permitted usage of the accommodation.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfRooms
sh:property.sh:description: The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the acccommodation or lodging business. Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

sh:property.sh:name: amenityFeature
sh:property.sh:description: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment:
An accommodation is a place that can accommodate human beings, e.g. a hotel room, a camping pitch, or a meeting room. Many accommodations are for overnight stays, but this is not a mandatory requirement. For more specific types of accommodations not defined in schema.org, one can use additionalType with external vocabularies.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Accommodation

sh:property.sh:name: floorSize
sh:property.sh:description: The size of the accommodation, e.g. in square meter or squarefoot. Typical unit code(s): MTK for square meter, FTK for square foot, or YDK for square yard

sh:property.sh:name: unitText
sh:property.sh:description: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Type and quantity node
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A structured value indicating the quantity, unit of measurement, and business function of goods included in a bundle offer.

sh:property.sh:name: businessFunction
sh:property.sh:description: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Business function
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
The business function specifies the type of activity or access (i.e., the bundle of rights) offered by the organization or business person through the offer. Typical are sell, rental or lease, maintenance or repair, manufacture / produce, recycle / dispose, engineering / construction, or installation. Proprietary specifications of access rights are also instances of this class.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ConstructionInstallation
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Dispose
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#LeaseOut
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Maintain
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ProvideService
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Repair
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Buy

sh:property.sh:name: unitCode
sh:property.sh:description: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

sh:property.sh:name: amountOfThisGood
sh:property.sh:description: The quantity of the goods included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: typeOfGood
sh:property.sh:description: The product that this structured value is referring to.

sh:property.sh:name: printPage
sh:property.sh:description: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).

sh:property.sh:name: printColumn
sh:property.sh:description: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment:
A NewsArticle is an article whose content reports news, or provides background context and supporting materials for understanding the news.
A more detailed overview of [schema.org News markup](/docs/news.html) is also available.

sh:property.sh:name: printEdition
sh:property.sh:description: The edition of the print product in which the NewsArticle appears.

sh:property.sh:name: dateline
sh:property.sh:description: A [dateline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dateline) is a brief piece of text included in news articles that describes where and when the story was written or filed though the date is often omitted. Sometimes only a placename is provided.

sh:property.sh:name: articleBody
