sh:property.sh:description: The actual body of the article.

sh:property.sh:name: pagination
sh:property.sh:description: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

sh:property.sh:name: wordCount
sh:property.sh:description: The number of words in the text of the Article.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

sh:property.sh:name: articleSection
sh:property.sh:description: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: pageStart
sh:property.sh:description: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

sh:property.sh:name: pageEnd
sh:property.sh:description: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Article

sh:property.sh:name: printSection
sh:property.sh:description: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the print section in which the article appeared.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: News article

sh:property.sh:name: minValue
sh:property.sh:description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

sh:property.sh:name: valueMaxLength
sh:property.sh:description: Specifies the allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

sh:property.sh:name: multipleValues
sh:property.sh:description: Whether multiple values are allowed for the property. Default is false.

sh:property.sh:name: maxValue
sh:property.sh:description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

sh:property.sh:name: valueRequired
sh:property.sh:description: Whether the property must be filled in to complete the action. Default is false.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A Property value specification.

sh:property.sh:name: valueMinLength
sh:property.sh:description: Specifies the minimum allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

sh:property.sh:name: readonlyValue
sh:property.sh:description: Whether or not a property is mutable. Default is false. Specifying this for a property that also has a value makes it act similar to a "hidden" input in an HTML form.

sh:property.sh:name: valuePattern
sh:property.sh:description: Specifies a regular expression for testing literal values according to the HTML spec.

sh:property.sh:name: stepValue
sh:property.sh:description: The stepValue attribute indicates the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value in a PropertyValueSpecification.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Property value specification

sh:property.sh:name: valueName
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates the name of the PropertyValueSpecification to be used in URL templates and form encoding in a manner analogous to HTML's input@name.

sh:property.sh:name: defaultValue
sh:property.sh:description: The default value of the input. For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Offer

sh:property.sh:name: gtin8
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-8](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-8.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: inventoryLevel
sh:property.sh:description: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

sh:property.sh:name: offeredBy
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: validFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The date when the item becomes valid.

sh:property.sh:name: areaServed
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

sh:property.sh:name: availabilityStarts
sh:property.sh:description: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleDuration
sh:property.sh:description: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.\n\nFor [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

sh:property.sh:name: reviews
sh:property.sh:description: Review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: availableDeliveryMethod
sh:property.sh:description: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

sh:property.sh:name: category
sh:property.sh:description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

sh:property.sh:name: deliveryLeadTime
sh:property.sh:description: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin13
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-13](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-13.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: seller
sh:property.sh:description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods. A seller may also be a provider.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin14
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-14](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-14.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: itemOffered
sh:property.sh:description: The item being offered.

sh:property.sh:name: priceSpecification
sh:property.sh:description: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

sh:property.sh:name: availableAtOrFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

sh:property.sh:name: ineligibleRegion
sh:property.sh:description: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleTransactionVolume
sh:property.sh:description: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

sh:property.sh:name: advanceBookingRequirement
sh:property.sh:description: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

sh:property.sh:name: review
sh:property.sh:description: A review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: requiredCollateral
sh:property.sh:description: Assets required to secure loan or credit repayments. It may take form of third party pledge, goods, financial instruments (cash, securities, etc.)

sh:property.sh:name: loanTerm
sh:property.sh:description: The duration of the loan or credit agreement.

sh:property.sh:name: amount
sh:property.sh:description: The amount of money.

sh:property.sh:name: interestRate
sh:property.sh:description: The interest rate, charged or paid, applicable to the financial product. Note: This is different from the calculated annualPercentageRate.

sh:property.sh:name: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
sh:property.sh:description: Description of fees, commissions, and other terms applied either to a class of financial product, or by a financial service organization.

sh:property.sh:name: annualPercentageRate
sh:property.sh:description: The annual rate that is charged for borrowing (or made by investing), expressed as a single percentage number that represents the actual yearly cost of funds over the term of a loan. This includes any fees or additional costs associated with the transaction.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Financial product
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A product provided to consumers and businesses by financial institutions such as banks, insurance companies, brokerage firms, consumer finance companies, and investment companies which comprise the financial services industry.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Loan or credit
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A financial product for the loaning of an amount of money under agreed terms and charges.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Payment method
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A payment method is a standardized procedure for transferring the monetary amount for a purchase. Payment methods are characterized by the legal and technical structures used, and by the organization or group carrying out the transaction.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByBankTransferInAdvance
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByInvoice
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Cash
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#CheckInAdvance
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#COD
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DirectDebit
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#GoogleCheckout
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PayPal
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PaySwarm

sh:property.sh:name: acceptedPaymentMethod
sh:property.sh:description: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleCustomerType
sh:property.sh:description: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Business entity type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A business entity type is a conceptual entity representing the legal form, the size, the main line of business, the position in the value chain, or any combination thereof, of an organization or business person.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Business
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Enduser
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PublicInstitution
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Reseller

sh:property.sh:name: includesObject
sh:property.sh:description: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: addOn
sh:property.sh:description: An additional offer that can only be obtained in combination with the first base offer (e.g. supplements and extensions that are available for a surcharge).

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleRegion
sh:property.sh:description: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

sh:property.sh:name: serialNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: priceValidUntil
sh:property.sh:description: The date after which the price is no longer available.

sh:property.sh:name: itemCondition
sh:property.sh:description: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: mpn
sh:property.sh:description: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

sh:property.sh:name: warranty
sh:property.sh:description: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: warrantyScope
sh:property.sh:description: The scope of the warranty promise.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Warranty scope
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A range of of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Labor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-PickUp

sh:property.sh:name: durationOfWarranty
sh:property.sh:description: The duration of the warranty promise. Common unitCode values are ANN for year, MON for months, or DAY for days.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Warranty promise
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A structured value representing the duration and scope of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

sh:property.sh:name: validThrough
sh:property.sh:description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin12
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-12](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-12.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: availability
sh:property.sh:description: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Item availability
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A list of possible product availability options.

sh:property.sh:name: availabilityEnds
sh:property.sh:description: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: businessFunction
sh:property.sh:description: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

sh:property.sh:name: sku
sh:property.sh:description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

sh:property.sh:name: price
sh:property.sh:description:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with [ISO 4217 codes](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) e.g. "USD") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleQuantity
sh:property.sh:description: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

sh:property.sh:name: priceCurrency
sh:property.sh:description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.

sh:property.sh:name: aggregateRating
sh:property.sh:description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: serviceArea
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where the service is provided.

sh:property.sh:name: areaServed
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Contact point

sh:property.sh:name: contactType
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

sh:property.sh:name: contactOption
sh:property.sh:description: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Contact point option
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Enumerated options related to a ContactPoint.

sh:property.sh:name: faxNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The fax number.

sh:property.sh:name: telephone
sh:property.sh:description: The telephone number.

sh:property.sh:name: productSupported
sh:property.sh:description: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").

sh:property.sh:name: hoursAvailable
sh:property.sh:description: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

sh:property.sh:name: email
sh:property.sh:description: Email address.

sh:property.sh:name: availableLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

sh:property.sh:name: countryOfOrigin
sh:property.sh:description: The country of the principal offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie or program.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A movie.

sh:property.sh:name: subtitleLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in [IETF BCP 47 standard format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: trailer
sh:property.sh:description: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: videoQuality
sh:property.sh:description: The quality of the video.

sh:property.sh:name: musicBy
sh:property.sh:description: The composer of the soundtrack.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Video object
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A video file.

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: thumbnail
sh:property.sh:description: Thumbnail image for an image or video.

sh:property.sh:name: directors
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: actors
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: videoFrameSize
sh:property.sh:description: The frame size of the video.

sh:property.sh:name: caption
sh:property.sh:description: The caption for this object.

sh:property.sh:name: transcript
sh:property.sh:description: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

sh:property.sh:name: actors
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: directors
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: duration
sh:property.sh:description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

sh:property.sh:name: musicBy
sh:property.sh:description: The composer of the soundtrack.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Movie

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: productionCompany
sh:property.sh:description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

sh:property.sh:name: seasons
sh:property.sh:description: A season in a media series.

sh:property.sh:name: productionCompany
sh:property.sh:description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfSeasons
sh:property.sh:description: The number of seasons in this series.

sh:property.sh:name: directors
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Radio series

sh:property.sh:name: actors
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: musicBy
sh:property.sh:description: The composer of the soundtrack.

sh:property.sh:name: episode
sh:property.sh:description: An episode of a tv, radio or game media within a series or season.

sh:property.sh:name: containsSeason
sh:property.sh:description: A season that is part of the media series.

sh:property.sh:name: trailer
sh:property.sh:description: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: startDate
sh:property.sh:description: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:property.sh:name: issn
sh:property.sh:description: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

sh:property.sh:name: endDate
sh:property.sh:description: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Creative work series
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A CreativeWorkSeries in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. CreativeWorkSeries are usually organized into some order, often chronological. Unlike [[ItemList]] which is a general purpose data structure for lists of things, the emphasis with CreativeWorkSeries is on published materials (written e.g. books and periodicals, or media such as tv, radio and games).

Specific subtypes are available for describing [[TVSeries]], [[RadioSeries]], [[MovieSeries]], [[BookSeries]], [[Periodical]] and [[VideoGameSeries]]. In each case, the [[hasPart]] / [[isPartOf]] properties can be used to relate the CreativeWorkSeries to its parts. The general CreativeWorkSeries type serves largely just to organize these more specific and practical subtypes.

It is common for properties applicable to an item from the series to be usefully applied to the containing group. Schema.org attempts to anticipate some of these cases, but publishers should be free to apply properties of the series parts to the series as a whole wherever they seem appropriate.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfEpisodes
sh:property.sh:description: The number of episodes in this season or series.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: episodes
sh:property.sh:description: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

sh:property.sh:name: season
sh:property.sh:description: A season in a media series.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Episode

sh:property.sh:name: productionCompany
sh:property.sh:description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: partOfSeries
sh:property.sh:description: The series to which this episode or season belongs.

sh:property.sh:name: actors
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: directors
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: episodeNumber
sh:property.sh:description: Position of the episode within an ordered group of episodes.

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: trailer
sh:property.sh:description: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A media episode (e.g. TV, radio, video game) which can be part of a series or season.

sh:property.sh:name: partOfSeason
sh:property.sh:description: The season to which this episode belongs.

sh:property.sh:name: musicBy
sh:property.sh:description: The composer of the soundtrack.

sh:property.sh:name: serialNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin14
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-14](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-14.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: availabilityEnds
sh:property.sh:description: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: areaServed
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

sh:property.sh:name: availableAtOrFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

sh:property.sh:name: deliveryLeadTime
sh:property.sh:description: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

sh:property.sh:name: warranty
sh:property.sh:description: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: itemOffered
sh:property.sh:description: The item being offered.

sh:property.sh:name: availabilityStarts
sh:property.sh:description: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: advanceBookingRequirement
sh:property.sh:description: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

sh:property.sh:name: priceSpecification
sh:property.sh:description: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

sh:property.sh:name: ineligibleRegion
sh:property.sh:description: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

sh:property.sh:name: gtin8
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-8](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-8.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleRegion
sh:property.sh:description: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleTransactionVolume
sh:property.sh:description: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

sh:property.sh:name: validThrough
sh:property.sh:description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

sh:property.sh:name: validFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The date when the item becomes valid.

sh:property.sh:name: itemCondition
sh:property.sh:description: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleQuantity
sh:property.sh:description: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Demand

sh:property.sh:name: sku
sh:property.sh:description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

sh:property.sh:name: includesObject
sh:property.sh:description: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.

sh:property.sh:name: availability
sh:property.sh:description: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

sh:property.sh:name: mpn
sh:property.sh:description: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleDuration
sh:property.sh:description: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

sh:property.sh:name: seller
sh:property.sh:description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods. A seller may also be a provider.

sh:property.sh:name: inventoryLevel
sh:property.sh:description: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin13
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-13](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-13.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: businessFunction
sh:property.sh:description: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleCustomerType
sh:property.sh:description: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

sh:property.sh:name: availableDeliveryMethod
sh:property.sh:description: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

sh:property.sh:name: gtin12
sh:property.sh:description: The [GTIN-12](http://apps.gs1.org/GDD/glossary/Pages/GTIN-12.aspx) code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

sh:property.sh:name: acceptedPaymentMethod
sh:property.sh:description: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: How to direction
rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A direction indicating a single action to do in the instructions for how to achieve a result.

sh:property.sh:name: prepTime
sh:property.sh:description: The length of time it takes to prepare the items to be used in instructions or a direction, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

sh:property.sh:name: estimatedCost
sh:property.sh:description: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.

sh:property.sh:name: requiredQuantity
sh:property.sh:description: The required quantity of the item(s).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: How to item
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An item used as either a tool or supply when performing the instructions for how to to achieve a result.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: How to supply
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A supply consumed when performing the instructions for how to achieve a result.

sh:property.sh:name: supply
sh:property.sh:description: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.

sh:property.sh:name: afterMedia
sh:property.sh:description: A media object representing the circumstances after performing this direction.

sh:property.sh:name: beforeMedia
sh:property.sh:description: A media object representing the circumstances before performing this direction.

sh:property.sh:name: duringMedia
sh:property.sh:description: A media object representing the circumstances while performing this direction.

sh:property.sh:name: totalTime
sh:property.sh:description: The total time required to perform instructions or a direction (including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: How to tool
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A tool used (but not consumed) when performing instructions for how to achieve a result.

sh:property.sh:name: tool
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.

sh:property.sh:name: performTime
sh:property.sh:description: The length of time it takes to perform instructions or a direction (not including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

sh:property.sh:name: billingAddress
sh:property.sh:description: The billing address for the order.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentDue
sh:property.sh:description: The date that payment is due.

sh:property.sh:name: isGift
sh:property.sh:description: Was the offer accepted as a gift for someone other than the buyer.

sh:property.sh:name: confirmationNumber
sh:property.sh:description: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentMethodId
sh:property.sh:description: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

sh:property.sh:name: orderDelivery
sh:property.sh:description: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

sh:property.sh:name: orderDate
sh:property.sh:description: Date order was placed.

sh:property.sh:name: discount
sh:property.sh:description: Any discount applied (to an Order).

sh:property.sh:name: orderStatus
sh:property.sh:description: The current status of the order.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Order status
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Enumerated status values for Order.

sh:property.sh:name: partOfInvoice
sh:property.sh:description: The order is being paid as part of the referenced Invoice.

sh:property.sh:name: category
sh:property.sh:description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

sh:property.sh:name: billingPeriod
sh:property.sh:description: The time interval used to compute the invoice.

sh:property.sh:name: totalPaymentDue
sh:property.sh:description: The total amount due.

sh:property.sh:name: customer
sh:property.sh:description: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

sh:property.sh:name: minimumPaymentDue
sh:property.sh:description: The minimum payment required at this time.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentMethod
sh:property.sh:description: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

sh:property.sh:name: broker
sh:property.sh:description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller. In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange. If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

sh:property.sh:name: referencesOrder
sh:property.sh:description: The Order(s) related to this Invoice. One or more Orders may be combined into a single Invoice.

sh:property.sh:name: provider
sh:property.sh:description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentDueDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date that payment is due.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A statement of the money due for goods or services; a bill.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Payment status type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A specific payment status. For example, PaymentDue, PaymentComplete, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentStatus
sh:property.sh:description: The status of payment; whether the invoice has been paid or not.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentDue
sh:property.sh:description: The date that payment is due.

sh:property.sh:name: accountId
sh:property.sh:description: The identifier for the account the payment will be applied to.

sh:property.sh:name: confirmationNumber
sh:property.sh:description: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentMethodId
sh:property.sh:description: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

sh:property.sh:name: scheduledPaymentDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date the invoice is scheduled to be paid.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Invoice

sh:property.sh:name: paymentMethod
sh:property.sh:description: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

sh:property.sh:name: merchant
sh:property.sh:description: 'merchant' is an out-dated term for 'seller'.

sh:property.sh:name: customer
sh:property.sh:description: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

sh:property.sh:name: orderQuantity
sh:property.sh:description: The number of the item ordered. If the property is not set, assume the quantity is one.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An order item is a line of an order. It includes the quantity and shipping details of a bought offer.

sh:property.sh:name: orderedItem
sh:property.sh:description: The item ordered.

sh:property.sh:name: orderItemStatus
sh:property.sh:description: The current status of the order item.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Order item

sh:property.sh:name: orderItemNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The identifier of the order item.

sh:property.sh:name: orderDelivery
sh:property.sh:description: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

sh:property.sh:name: orderedItem
sh:property.sh:description: The item ordered.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentUrl
sh:property.sh:description: The URL for sending a payment.

sh:property.sh:name: discountCurrency
sh:property.sh:description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the discount.

sh:property.sh:name: discountCode
sh:property.sh:description: Code used to redeem a discount.

sh:property.sh:name: seller
sh:property.sh:description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods. A seller may also be a provider.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Order

sh:property.sh:name: acceptedOffer
sh:property.sh:description: The offer(s) -- e.g., product, quantity and price combinations -- included in the order.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentDueDate
sh:property.sh:description: The date that payment is due.

sh:property.sh:name: broker
sh:property.sh:description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller. In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange. If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An order is a confirmation of a transaction (a receipt), which can contain multiple line items, each represented by an Offer that has been accepted by the customer.

sh:property.sh:name: orderNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The identifier of the transaction.

sh:property.sh:name: accessibilityAPI
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

sh:property.sh:name: isBasedOnUrl
sh:property.sh:description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

sh:property.sh:name: audience
sh:property.sh:description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

sh:property.sh:name: creator
sh:property.sh:description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: isAccessibleForFree
sh:property.sh:description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

sh:property.sh:name: headline
sh:property.sh:description: Headline of the article.

sh:property.sh:name: typicalAgeRange
sh:property.sh:description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

sh:property.sh:name: accessibilityFeature
sh:property.sh:description: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

sh:property.sh:name: thumbnailUrl
sh:property.sh:description: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

sh:property.sh:name: author
sh:property.sh:description: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

sh:property.sh:name: commentCount
sh:property.sh:description: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

sh:property.sh:name: dateModified
sh:property.sh:description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

sh:property.sh:name: award
sh:property.sh:description: An award won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: educationalAlignment
sh:property.sh:description: An alignment to an established educational framework.

sh:property.sh:name: targetUrl
sh:property.sh:description: The URL of a node in an established educational framework.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

sh:property.sh:name: alignmentType
sh:property.sh:description: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: 'assesses', 'teaches', 'requires', 'textComplexity', 'readingLevel', 'educationalSubject', and 'educationalLevel'.

sh:property.sh:name: educationalFramework
sh:property.sh:description: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.

sh:property.sh:name: targetName
sh:property.sh:description: The name of a node in an established educational framework.

sh:property.sh:name: targetDescription
sh:property.sh:description: The description of a node in an established educational framework.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Alignment object

sh:property.sh:name: interactivityType
sh:property.sh:description: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

sh:property.sh:name: provider
sh:property.sh:description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

sh:property.sh:name: character
sh:property.sh:description: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

sh:property.sh:name: copyrightHolder
sh:property.sh:description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: comment
sh:property.sh:description: Comments, typically from users.

sh:property.sh:name: upvoteCount
sh:property.sh:description: The number of upvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

sh:property.sh:name: parentItem
sh:property.sh:description: The parent of a question, answer or item in general.

sh:property.sh:name: answerCount
sh:property.sh:description: The number of answers this question has received.

sh:property.sh:name: downvoteCount
sh:property.sh:description: The number of downvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Question

sh:property.sh:name: acceptedAnswer
sh:property.sh:description: The answer that has been accepted as best, typically on a Question/Answer site. Sites vary in their selection mechanisms, e.g. drawing on community opinion and/or the view of the Question author.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Answer
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An answer offered to a question; perhaps correct, perhaps opinionated or wrong.

sh:property.sh:name: suggestedAnswer
sh:property.sh:description: An answer (possibly one of several, possibly incorrect) to a Question, e.g. on a Question/Answer site.

sh:property.sh:name: upvoteCount
sh:property.sh:description: The number of upvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A specific question - e.g. from a user seeking answers online, or collected in a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document.

sh:property.sh:name: downvoteCount
sh:property.sh:description: The number of downvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Comment
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A comment on an item - for example, a comment on a blog post. The comment's content is expressed via the [[text]] property, and its topic via [[about]], properties shared with all CreativeWorks.

sh:property.sh:name: releasedEvent
sh:property.sh:description: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

sh:property.sh:name: publishedOn
sh:property.sh:description: A broadcast service associated with the publication event.

sh:property.sh:name: isAccessibleForFree
sh:property.sh:description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

sh:property.sh:name: free
sh:property.sh:description: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Publication event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A PublicationEvent corresponds indifferently to the event of publication for a CreativeWork of any type e.g. a broadcast event, an on-demand event, a book/journal publication via a variety of delivery media.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: sponsor
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

sh:property.sh:name: dateCreated
sh:property.sh:description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

sh:property.sh:name: locationCreated
sh:property.sh:description: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: educationalUse
sh:property.sh:description: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

sh:property.sh:name: mainEntity
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: associatedMedia
sh:property.sh:description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

sh:property.sh:name: audio
sh:property.sh:description: An embedded audio object.

sh:property.sh:name: transcript
sh:property.sh:description: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Audio object
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An audio file.

sh:property.sh:name: sourceOrganization
sh:property.sh:description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

sh:property.sh:name: recordedAt
sh:property.sh:description: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

sh:property.sh:name: isPartOf
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of.

sh:property.sh:name: review
sh:property.sh:description: A review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: accessibilityHazard
sh:property.sh:description: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

sh:property.sh:name: genre
sh:property.sh:description: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

sh:property.sh:name: isBasedOn
sh:property.sh:description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

sh:property.sh:name: copyrightYear
sh:property.sh:description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

sh:property.sh:name: temporalCoverage
sh:property.sh:description: The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in [ISO 8601 time interval format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals). In the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL. Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

sh:property.sh:name: publishingPrinciples
sh:property.sh:description:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].
While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

sh:property.sh:name: license
sh:property.sh:description: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

sh:property.sh:name: awards
sh:property.sh:description: Awards won by or for this item.

sh:property.sh:name: publication
sh:property.sh:description: A publication event associated with the item.

sh:property.sh:name: encoding
sh:property.sh:description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

sh:property.sh:name: discussionUrl
sh:property.sh:description: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: editor
sh:property.sh:description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: producer
sh:property.sh:description: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

sh:property.sh:name: funder
sh:property.sh:description: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

sh:property.sh:name: material
sh:property.sh:description: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

sh:property.sh:name: text
sh:property.sh:description: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: timeRequired
sh:property.sh:description: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.

sh:property.sh:name: mentions
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

sh:property.sh:name: accountablePerson
sh:property.sh:description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: encodings
sh:property.sh:description: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: contributor
sh:property.sh:description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

sh:property.sh:name: publisher
sh:property.sh:description: The publisher of the creative work.

sh:property.sh:name: alternativeHeadline
sh:property.sh:description: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: inLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Creative work

sh:property.sh:name: reviews
sh:property.sh:description: Review of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: accessibilityControl
sh:property.sh:description: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource ([WebSchemas wiki lists possible values](http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Accessibility)).

sh:property.sh:name: about
sh:property.sh:description: The subject matter of the content.

sh:property.sh:name: hasPart
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork.

sh:property.sh:name: spatialCoverage
sh:property.sh:description: The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

sh:property.sh:name: keywords
sh:property.sh:description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

sh:property.sh:name: expires
sh:property.sh:description: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a [[VideoObject]] or [[NewsArticle]] whose availability or relevance is time-limited, or a [[ClaimReview]] fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date.

sh:property.sh:name: interactionStatistic
sh:property.sh:description: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

sh:property.sh:name: userInteractionCount
sh:property.sh:description: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication.

sh:property.sh:name: interactionType
sh:property.sh:description: The Action representing the type of interaction. For up votes, +1s, etc. use [[LikeAction]]. For down votes use [[DislikeAction]]. Otherwise, use the most specific Action.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Software application

sh:property.sh:name: permissions
sh:property.sh:description: Permission(s) required to run the app (for example, a mobile app may require full internet access or may run only on wifi).

sh:property.sh:name: operatingSystem
sh:property.sh:description: Operating systems supported (Windows 7, OSX 10.6, Android 1.6).

sh:property.sh:name: downloadUrl
sh:property.sh:description: If the file can be downloaded, URL to download the binary.

sh:property.sh:name: countriesNotSupported
sh:property.sh:description: Countries for which the application is not supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

sh:property.sh:name: availableOnDevice
sh:property.sh:description: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

sh:property.sh:name: screenshot
sh:property.sh:description: A link to a screenshot image of the app.

sh:property.sh:name: processorRequirements
sh:property.sh:description: Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).

sh:property.sh:name: applicationSubCategory
sh:property.sh:description: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.

sh:property.sh:name: softwareVersion
sh:property.sh:description: Version of the software instance.

sh:property.sh:name: applicationSuite
sh:property.sh:description: The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).

sh:property.sh:name: fileSize
sh:property.sh:description: Size of the application / package (e.g. 18MB). In the absence of a unit (MB, KB etc.), KB will be assumed.

sh:property.sh:name: featureList
sh:property.sh:description: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

sh:property.sh:name: applicationCategory
sh:property.sh:description: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.

sh:property.sh:name: softwareHelp
sh:property.sh:description: Software application help.

sh:property.sh:name: countriesSupported
sh:property.sh:description: Countries for which the application is supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

sh:property.sh:name: releaseNotes
sh:property.sh:description: Description of what changed in this version.

sh:property.sh:name: softwareRequirements
sh:property.sh:description: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

sh:property.sh:name: storageRequirements
sh:property.sh:description: Storage requirements (free space required).

sh:property.sh:name: installUrl
sh:property.sh:description: URL at which the app may be installed, if different from the URL of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: device
sh:property.sh:description: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

sh:property.sh:name: requirements
sh:property.sh:description: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

sh:property.sh:name: supportingData
sh:property.sh:description: Supporting data for a SoftwareApplication.

sh:property.sh:name: item
sh:property.sh:description: An entity represented by an entry in a list or data feed (e.g. an 'artist' in a list of 'artists')’.

sh:property.sh:name: dateModified
sh:property.sh:description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

sh:property.sh:name: dateDeleted
sh:property.sh:description: The datetime the item was removed from the DataFeed.

sh:property.sh:name: dateCreated
sh:property.sh:description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Data feed item
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A single item within a larger data feed.

sh:property.sh:name: dataFeedElement
sh:property.sh:description: An item within in a data feed. Data feeds may have many elements.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Data feed
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A single feed providing structured information about one or more entities or topics.
A software application.

sh:property.sh:name: softwareAddOn
sh:property.sh:description: Additional content for a software application.

sh:property.sh:name: memoryRequirements
sh:property.sh:description: Minimum memory requirements.

sh:property.sh:name: issn
sh:property.sh:description: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Web site
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and accessible via URLs.

sh:property.sh:name: interactionService
sh:property.sh:description: The WebSite or SoftwareApplication where the interactions took place.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Interaction counter
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A summary of how users have interacted with this CreativeWork. In most cases, authors will use a subtype to specify the specific type of interaction.

sh:property.sh:name: translator
sh:property.sh:description: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

sh:property.sh:name: schemaVersion
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as http://schema.org/version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

sh:property.sh:name: accessibilitySummary
sh:property.sh:description: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."

sh:property.sh:name: exampleOfWork
sh:property.sh:description: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

sh:property.sh:name: offers
sh:property.sh:description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

sh:property.sh:name: contentRating
sh:property.sh:description: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

sh:property.sh:name: workExample
sh:property.sh:description: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.

sh:property.sh:name: datePublished
sh:property.sh:description: Date of first broadcast/publication.

sh:property.sh:name: position
sh:property.sh:description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

sh:property.sh:name: citation
sh:property.sh:description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: fileFormat
sh:property.sh:description: Media type, typically MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml)) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

sh:property.sh:name: aggregateRating
sh:property.sh:description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: accessMode
sh:property.sh:description: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.

sh:property.sh:name: contentLocation
sh:property.sh:description: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

sh:property.sh:name: isFamilyFriendly
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

sh:property.sh:name: accessModeSufficient
sh:property.sh:description: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual.

sh:property.sh:name: version
sh:property.sh:description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

sh:property.sh:name: learningResourceType
sh:property.sh:description: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

sh:property.sh:name: video
sh:property.sh:description: An embedded video object.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: Describes a reservation for travel, dining or an event. Some reservations require tickets. \n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, restaurant reservations, flights, or rental cars, use [[Offer]].

sh:property.sh:name: reservationId
sh:property.sh:description: A unique identifier for the reservation.

sh:property.sh:name: totalPrice
sh:property.sh:description: The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: reservedTicket
sh:property.sh:description: A ticket associated with the reservation.

sh:property.sh:name: ticketNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The unique identifier for the ticket.

sh:property.sh:name: issuedBy
sh:property.sh:description: The organization issuing the ticket or permit.

sh:property.sh:name: dateIssued
sh:property.sh:description: The date the ticket was issued.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Used to describe a ticket to an event, a flight, a bus ride, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: underName
sh:property.sh:description: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

sh:property.sh:name: ticketToken
sh:property.sh:description: Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.

sh:property.sh:name: priceCurrency
sh:property.sh:description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Ticket

sh:property.sh:name: ticketedSeat
sh:property.sh:description: The seat associated with the ticket.

sh:property.sh:name: seatingType
sh:property.sh:description: The type/class of the seat.

sh:property.sh:name: seatSection
sh:property.sh:description: The section location of the reserved seat (e.g. Orchestra).

sh:property.sh:name: seatRow
sh:property.sh:description: The row location of the reserved seat (e.g., B).

sh:property.sh:name: seatNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The location of the reserved seat (e.g., 27).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Seat
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Used to describe a seat, such as a reserved seat in an event reservation.

sh:property.sh:name: totalPrice
sh:property.sh:description: The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: reservationStatus
sh:property.sh:description: The current status of the reservation.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Reservation status type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Enumerated status values for Reservation.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Reservation

sh:property.sh:name: underName
sh:property.sh:description: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

sh:property.sh:name: bookingTime
sh:property.sh:description: The date and time the reservation was booked.

sh:property.sh:name: modifiedTime
sh:property.sh:description: The date and time the reservation was modified.

sh:property.sh:name: broker
sh:property.sh:description: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller. In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange. If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

sh:property.sh:name: bookingAgent
sh:property.sh:description: 'bookingAgent' is an out-dated term indicating a 'broker' that serves as a booking agent.

sh:property.sh:name: priceCurrency
sh:property.sh:description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.

sh:property.sh:name: provider
sh:property.sh:description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

sh:property.sh:name: programMembershipUsed
sh:property.sh:description: Any membership in a frequent flyer, hotel loyalty program, etc. being applied to the reservation.

sh:property.sh:name: reservationFor
sh:property.sh:description: The thing -- flight, event, restaurant,etc. being reserved.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A trip on a commercial bus line.

sh:property.sh:name: busNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The unique identifier for the bus.

sh:property.sh:name: busName
sh:property.sh:description: The name of the bus (e.g. Bolt Express).

sh:property.sh:name: openingHours
sh:property.sh:description: The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. * Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: ```Mo```, ```Tu```, ```We```, ```Th```, ```Fr```, ```Sa```, ```Su```. * Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as ```15:00```. * Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. * If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Civic structure
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A public structure, such as a town hall or concert hall.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Bus station
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A bus station.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Bus stop
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A bus stop.

sh:property.sh:name: departureBusStop
sh:property.sh:description: The stop or station from which the bus departs.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Bus trip

sh:property.sh:name: provider
sh:property.sh:description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalBusStop
sh:property.sh:description: The stop or station from which the bus arrives.

sh:property.sh:name: departureTime
sh:property.sh:description: The expected departure time.

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalTime
sh:property.sh:description: The expected arrival time.

sh:property.sh:name: paymentAccepted
sh:property.sh:description: Cash, credit card, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: openingHours
sh:property.sh:description: The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. * Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: ```Mo```, ```Tu```, ```We```, ```Th```, ```Fr```, ```Sa```, ```Su```. * Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as ```15:00```. * Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. * If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Local business

sh:property.sh:name: currenciesAccepted
sh:property.sh:description: The currency accepted (in [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)).

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A particular physical business or branch of an organization. Examples of LocalBusiness include a restaurant, a particular branch of a restaurant chain, a branch of a bank, a medical practice, a club, a bowling alley, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: priceRange
sh:property.sh:description: The price range of the business, for example ```$$$```.

sh:property.sh:name: branchOf
sh:property.sh:description: The larger organization that this local business is a branch of, if any. Not to be confused with (anatomical)[[branch]].

sh:property.sh:name: productionCompany
sh:property.sh:description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

sh:property.sh:name: startDate
sh:property.sh:description: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfEpisodes
sh:property.sh:description: The number of episodes in this season or series.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Creative work season

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: episodes
sh:property.sh:description: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

sh:property.sh:name: episode
sh:property.sh:description: An episode of a tv, radio or game media within a series or season.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A media season e.g. tv, radio, video game etc.

sh:property.sh:name: endDate
sh:property.sh:description: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:property.sh:name: partOfSeries
sh:property.sh:description: The series to which this episode or season belongs.

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: trailer
sh:property.sh:description: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: seasonNumber
sh:property.sh:description: Position of the season within an ordered group of seasons.

sh:property.sh:name: departurePlatform
sh:property.sh:description: The platform from which the train departs.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A trip on a commercial train line.

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalPlatform
sh:property.sh:description: The platform where the train arrives.

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalStation
sh:property.sh:description: The station where the train trip ends.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Train station
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A train station.

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalTime
sh:property.sh:description: The expected arrival time.

sh:property.sh:name: departureTime
sh:property.sh:description: The expected departure time.

sh:property.sh:name: trainName
sh:property.sh:description: The name of the train (e.g. The Orient Express).

sh:property.sh:name: trainNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The unique identifier for the train.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Train trip

sh:property.sh:name: departureStation
sh:property.sh:description: The station from which the train departs.

sh:property.sh:name: provider
sh:property.sh:description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

sh:property.sh:name: pagination
sh:property.sh:description: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Publication issue

sh:property.sh:name: pageEnd
sh:property.sh:description: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or publication volume, often numbered, usually containing a grouping of works such as articles.\n\n[blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

sh:property.sh:name: issueNumber
sh:property.sh:description: Identifies the issue of publication; for example, "iii" or "2".

sh:property.sh:name: pageStart
sh:property.sh:description: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

sh:property.sh:name: productionCompany
sh:property.sh:description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

sh:property.sh:name: embedUrl
