sh:property.sh:description: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the ```src``` element of an ```embed``` tag and should not be the same as the content of the ```loc``` tag.

sh:property.sh:name: playerType
sh:property.sh:description: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.

sh:property.sh:name: uploadDate
sh:property.sh:description: Date when this media object was uploaded to this site.

sh:property.sh:name: encodingFormat
sh:property.sh:description: mp3, mpeg4, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: encodesCreativeWork
sh:property.sh:description: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.

sh:property.sh:name: regionsAllowed
sh:property.sh:description: The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in [ISO 3166 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166).

sh:property.sh:name: requiresSubscription
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription (either paid or free). Allowed values are ```true``` or ```false``` (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').

sh:property.sh:name: bitrate
sh:property.sh:description: The bitrate of the media object.

sh:property.sh:name: associatedArticle
sh:property.sh:description: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.

sh:property.sh:name: width
sh:property.sh:description: The width of the item.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A media object, such as an image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).
rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Media object

sh:property.sh:name: contentSize
sh:property.sh:description: File size in (mega/kilo) bytes.

sh:property.sh:name: height
sh:property.sh:description: The height of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: duration
sh:property.sh:description: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

sh:property.sh:name: contentUrl
sh:property.sh:description: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

sh:property.sh:name: additionalProperty
sh:property.sh:description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

sh:property.sh:name: value
sh:property.sh:description:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.

sh:property.sh:name: unitCode
sh:property.sh:description: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Quantitative value

sh:property.sh:name: valueReference
sh:property.sh:description: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

sh:property.sh:name: minValue
sh:property.sh:description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

sh:property.sh:name: unitText
sh:property.sh:description: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

sh:property.sh:name: maxValue
sh:property.sh:description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

sh:property.sh:name: episode
sh:property.sh:description: An episode of a tv, radio or game media within a series or season.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfEpisodes
sh:property.sh:description: The number of episodes in this season or series.

sh:property.sh:name: containsSeason
sh:property.sh:description: A season that is part of the media series.

sh:property.sh:name: productionCompany
sh:property.sh:description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: TVSeries

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: trailer
sh:property.sh:description: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: episodes
sh:property.sh:description: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

sh:property.sh:name: seasons
sh:property.sh:description: A season in a media series.

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: directors
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

sh:property.sh:name: season
sh:property.sh:description: A season in a media series.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfSeasons
sh:property.sh:description: The number of seasons in this series.

sh:property.sh:name: actors
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: musicBy
sh:property.sh:description: The composer of the soundtrack.

sh:property.sh:name: countryOfOrigin
sh:property.sh:description: The country of the principal offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie or program.

sh:property.sh:name: genre
sh:property.sh:description: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

sh:property.sh:name: track
sh:property.sh:description: A music recording (track)—usually a single song. If an ItemList is given, the list should contain items of type MusicRecording.

sh:property.sh:name: musicGroupMember
sh:property.sh:description: A member of a music group—for example, John, Paul, George, or Ringo.

sh:property.sh:name: tracks
sh:property.sh:description: A music recording (track)—usually a single song.

sh:property.sh:name: album
sh:property.sh:description: A music album.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A musical group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a choir. Can also be a solo musician.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Performing group
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A performance group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a circus.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Music group

sh:property.sh:name: albums
sh:property.sh:description: A collection of music albums.

sh:property.sh:name: address
sh:property.sh:description: Physical address of the item.

sh:property.sh:name: postalCode
sh:property.sh:description: The postal code. For example, 94043.

sh:property.sh:name: elevation
sh:property.sh:description: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

sh:property.sh:name: latitude
sh:property.sh:description: The latitude of a location. For example ```37.42242``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Geo coordinates

sh:property.sh:name: longitude
sh:property.sh:description: The longitude of a location. For example ```-122.08585``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

sh:property.sh:name: addressCountry
sh:property.sh:description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

sh:property.sh:name: price
sh:property.sh:description:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with [ISO 4217 codes](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) e.g. "USD") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

sh:property.sh:name: priceCurrency
sh:property.sh:description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A structured value representing a price or price range. Typically, only the subclasses of this type are used for markup. It is recommended to use [[MonetaryAmount]] to describe independent amounts of money such as a salary, credit card limits, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: validFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The date when the item becomes valid.

sh:property.sh:name: valueAddedTaxIncluded
sh:property.sh:description: Specifies whether the applicable value-added tax (VAT) is included in the price specification or not.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleTransactionVolume
sh:property.sh:description: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

sh:property.sh:name: eligibleQuantity
sh:property.sh:description: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Price specification

sh:property.sh:name: validThrough
sh:property.sh:description: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

sh:property.sh:name: maxPrice
sh:property.sh:description: The highest price if the price is a range.

sh:property.sh:name: minPrice
sh:property.sh:description: The lowest price if the price is a range.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Dataset

sh:property.sh:name: includedDataCatalog
sh:property.sh:description: A data catalog which contains this dataset (this property was previously 'catalog', preferred name is now 'includedInDataCatalog').

sh:property.sh:name: dataset
sh:property.sh:description: A dataset contained in this catalog.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Data catalog
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A collection of datasets.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.

sh:property.sh:name: temporal
sh:property.sh:description: The range of temporal applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 (in ISO 8601 time interval format).

sh:property.sh:name: datasetTimeInterval
sh:property.sh:description: The range of temporal applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 (in ISO 8601 time interval format).

sh:property.sh:name: includedInDataCatalog
sh:property.sh:description: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

sh:property.sh:name: distribution
sh:property.sh:description: A downloadable form of this dataset, at a specific location, in a specific format.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Data download
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A dataset in downloadable form.

sh:property.sh:name: spatial
sh:property.sh:description: The range of spatial applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a dataset of New York weather, the state of New York.

sh:property.sh:name: catalog
sh:property.sh:description: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

sh:property.sh:name: issn
sh:property.sh:description: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

sh:property.sh:name: area
sh:property.sh:description: The area within which users can expect to reach the broadcast service.

sh:property.sh:name: broadcaster
sh:property.sh:description: The organization owning or operating the broadcast service.

sh:property.sh:name: broadcastTimezone
sh:property.sh:description: The timezone in [ISO 8601 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) for which the service bases its broadcasts

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A delivery service through which content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

sh:property.sh:name: videoFormat
sh:property.sh:description: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

sh:property.sh:name: broadcastDisplayName
sh:property.sh:description: The name displayed in the channel guide. For many US affiliates, it is the network name.

sh:property.sh:name: parentService
sh:property.sh:description: A broadcast service to which the broadcast service may belong to such as regional variations of a national channel.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Broadcast service

sh:property.sh:name: broadcastAffiliateOf
sh:property.sh:description: The media network(s) whose content is broadcast on this station.

sh:property.sh:name: issuedThrough
sh:property.sh:description: The service through with the permit was granted.

sh:property.sh:name: validFor
sh:property.sh:description: The time validity of the permit.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: A permit issued by an organization, e.g. a parking pass.

sh:property.sh:name: validIn
sh:property.sh:description: The geographic area where the permit is valid.

sh:property.sh:name: issuedBy
sh:property.sh:description: The organization issuing the ticket or permit.

sh:property.sh:name: validFrom
sh:property.sh:description: The date when the item becomes valid.

sh:property.sh:name: permitAudience
sh:property.sh:description: The target audience for this permit.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Permit

sh:property.sh:name: validUntil
sh:property.sh:description: The date when the item is no longer valid.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object. Optionally happens at a location with the help of an inanimate instrument. The execution of the action may produce a result. Specific action sub-type documentation specifies the exact expectation of each argument/role.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/04/announcing-schemaorg-actions.html) and [Actions overview document](http://schema.org/docs/actions.html).

sh:property.sh:name: result
sh:property.sh:description: The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote *a book*.

sh:property.sh:name: error
sh:property.sh:description: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.

sh:property.sh:name: participant
sh:property.sh:description: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

sh:property.sh:name: object
sh:property.sh:description: The object upon which the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). e.g. John read *a book*.

sh:property.sh:name: agent
sh:property.sh:description: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. *John* wrote a book.

sh:property.sh:name: instrument
sh:property.sh:description: The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with *a pen*.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Action

sh:property.sh:name: startTime
sh:property.sh:description: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

sh:property.sh:name: target
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.

sh:property.sh:name: urlTemplate
sh:property.sh:description: An url template (RFC6570) that will be used to construct the target of the execution of the action.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Entry point

sh:property.sh:name: actionApplication
sh:property.sh:description: An application that can complete the request.

sh:property.sh:name: actionPlatform
sh:property.sh:description: The high level platform(s) where the Action can be performed for the given URL. To specify a specific application or operating system instance, use actionApplication.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An entry point, within some Web-based protocol.

sh:property.sh:name: application
sh:property.sh:description: An application that can complete the request.

sh:property.sh:name: httpMethod
sh:property.sh:description: An HTTP method that specifies the appropriate HTTP method for a request to an HTTP EntryPoint. Values are capitalized strings as used in HTTP.

sh:property.sh:name: encodingType
sh:property.sh:description: The supported encoding type(s) for an EntryPoint request.

sh:property.sh:name: contentType
sh:property.sh:description: The supported content type(s) for an EntryPoint response.

sh:property.sh:name: location
sh:property.sh:description: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

sh:property.sh:name: actionStatus
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Action status type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The status of an Action.

sh:property.sh:name: endTime
sh:property.sh:description: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

sh:property.sh:name: seller
sh:property.sh:description: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods. A seller may also be a provider.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:comment: An airline flight.

sh:property.sh:name: departureAirport
sh:property.sh:description: The airport where the flight originates.

sh:property.sh:name: icaoCode
sh:property.sh:description: ICAO identifier for an airport.

sh:property.sh:name: iataCode
sh:property.sh:description: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Airport
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An airport.

sh:property.sh:name: aircraft
sh:property.sh:description: The kind of aircraft (e.g., "Boeing 747").

sh:property.sh:name: departureTerminal
sh:property.sh:description: Identifier of the flight's departure terminal.

sh:property.sh:name: boardingPolicy
sh:property.sh:description: The type of boarding policy used by the airline (e.g. zone-based or group-based).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Boarding policy type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A type of boarding policy used by an airline.

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalAirport
sh:property.sh:description: The airport where the flight terminates.

sh:property.sh:name: webCheckinTime
sh:property.sh:description: The time when a passenger can check into the flight online.

sh:property.sh:name: estimatedFlightDuration
sh:property.sh:description: The estimated time the flight will take.

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalGate
sh:property.sh:description: Identifier of the flight's arrival gate.

sh:property.sh:name: flightNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The unique identifier for a flight including the airline IATA code. For example, if describing United flight 110, where the IATA code for United is 'UA', the flightNumber is 'UA110'.

sh:property.sh:name: mealService
sh:property.sh:description: Description of the meals that will be provided or available for purchase.

rdfs:Class.rdfs:label: Flight

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalTime
sh:property.sh:description: The expected arrival time.

sh:property.sh:name: departureGate
sh:property.sh:description: Identifier of the flight's departure gate.

sh:property.sh:name: flightDistance
sh:property.sh:description: The distance of the flight.

sh:property.sh:name: carrier
sh:property.sh:description: 'carrier' is an out-dated term indicating the 'provider' for parcel delivery and flights.

sh:property.sh:name: provider
sh:property.sh:description: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

sh:property.sh:name: arrivalTerminal
sh:property.sh:description: Identifier of the flight's arrival terminal.

sh:property.sh:name: departureTime
sh:property.sh:description: The expected departure time.

schema:GameServerStatus.rdfs:label: Online full
schema:GameServerStatus.rdfs:comment: Game server status: OnlineFull. Server is online but unavailable. The maximum number of players has reached.

schema:Organization.rdfs:label: Dataset class
schema:Organization.rdfs:comment: This class is based upon W3C DCAT work, and benefits from collaboration around the DCAT, ADMS and VoID vocabularies. See http://www.w3.org/wiki/WebSchemas/Datasets for full details and mappings.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Music video object
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A music video file.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Education event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Event type: Education event.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Automotive business
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Car repair, sales, or parts.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Gas station

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Code
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

sh:property.sh:name: runtimePlatform
sh:property.sh:description: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0).

sh:property.sh:name: runtime
sh:property.sh:description: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0).

sh:property.sh:name: targetProduct
sh:property.sh:description: Target Operating System / Product to which the code applies. If applies to several versions, just the product name can be used.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Computer language
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: This type covers computer programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, as well as other language-like computer representations. Natural languages are best represented with the [[Language]] type.

sh:property.sh:name: programmingLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: The computer programming language.

sh:property.sh:name: codeSampleType
sh:property.sh:description: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

sh:property.sh:name: codeRepository
sh:property.sh:description: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, github, CodePlex).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Software source code

sh:property.sh:name: sampleType
sh:property.sh:description: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

schema:ItemAvailability.rdfs:label: In store only
schema:ItemAvailability.rdfs:comment: Indicates that the item is available only at physical locations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: College or university
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A college, university, or other third-level educational institution.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Television station
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A television station.

sh:property.sh:name: audience
sh:property.sh:description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

sh:property.sh:name: starRating
sh:property.sh:description: An official rating for a lodging business or food establishment, e.g. from national associations or standards bodies. Use the author property to indicate the rating organization, e.g. as an Organization with name such as (e.g. HOTREC, DEHOGA, WHR, or Hotelstars).

sh:property.sh:name: checkoutTime
sh:property.sh:description: The latest someone may check out of a lodging establishment.

sh:property.sh:name: checkinTime
sh:property.sh:description: The earliest someone may check into a lodging establishment.

sh:property.sh:name: amenityFeature
sh:property.sh:description: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

sh:property.sh:name: availableLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

sh:property.sh:name: petsAllowed
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Lodging business
Bed and breakfast
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
Bed and breakfast.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Dance group
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A dance group—for example, the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater or Riverdance.

sh:property.sh:name: primaryImageOfPage
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates the main image on the page.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Web page

sh:property.sh:name: specialty
sh:property.sh:description: One of the domain specialities to which this web page's content applies.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Specialty
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Any branch of a field in which people typically develop specific expertise, usually after significant study, time, and effort.

sh:property.sh:name: significantLinks
sh:property.sh:description: The most significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

sh:property.sh:name: lastReviewed
sh:property.sh:description: Date on which the content on this web page was last reviewed for accuracy and/or completeness.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A web page. Every web page is implicitly assumed to be declared to be of type WebPage, so the various properties about that webpage, such as breadcrumb may be used. We recommend explicit declaration if these properties are specified, but if they are found outside of an itemscope, they will be assumed to be about the page.

sh:property.sh:name: reviewedBy
sh:property.sh:description: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

sh:property.sh:name: significantLink
sh:property.sh:description: One of the more significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

sh:property.sh:name: relatedLink
sh:property.sh:description: A link related to this web page, for example to other related web pages.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Breadcrumb list
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A BreadcrumbList is an ItemList consisting of a chain of linked Web pages, typically described using at least their URL and their name, and typically ending with the current page.\n\nThe [[position]] property is used to reconstruct the order of the items in a BreadcrumbList The convention is that a breadcrumb list has an [[itemListOrder]] of [[ItemListOrderAscending]] (lower values listed first), and that the first items in this list correspond to the "top" or beginning of the breadcrumb trail, e.g. with a site or section homepage. The specific values of 'position' are not assigned meaning for a BreadcrumbList, but they should be integers, e.g. beginning with '1' for the first item in the list.

sh:property.sh:name: breadcrumb
sh:property.sh:description: A set of links that can help a user understand and navigate a website hierarchy.

sh:property.sh:name: mainContentOfPage
sh:property.sh:description: Indicates if this web page element is the main subject of the page.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Web page element
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A web page element, like a table or an image.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Web page type: Collection page.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: User interaction
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: User downloads
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

sh:property.sh:description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

sh:property.sh:name: about
sh:property.sh:description: The subject matter of the content.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of interacting with another person or organization.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Communicate action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of conveying information to another person via a communication medium (instrument) such as speech, email, or telephone conversation.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Check in action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their arrival by registering/confirming for a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or at a place (e.g. hotel), possibly resulting in a result (boarding pass, etc).

Related actions:

* [[CheckOutAction]]: The antonym of CheckInAction.
* [[ArriveAction]]: Unlike ArriveAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service.
* [[ConfirmAction]]: Unlike ConfirmAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the *start* of a previously reserved service rather than its validity/existence.

schema:ContactPointOption.rdfs:label: Hearing impaired supported
schema:ContactPointOption.rdfs:comment: Uses devices to support users with hearing impairments.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Geo circle
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A GeoCircle is a GeoShape representing a circular geographic area. As it is a GeoShape it provides the simple textual property 'circle', but also allows the combination of postalCode alongside geoRadius. The center of the circle can be indicated via the 'geoMidpoint' property, or more approximately using 'address', 'postalCode'.

sh:property.sh:name: countryOfOrigin
sh:property.sh:description: The country of the principal offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie or program.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: TVEpisode
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A TV episode which can be part of a series or season.

schema:Organization.rdfs:label: Good relations terms
schema:Organization.rdfs:comment: This term [uses](http://blog.schema.org/2012/11/good-relations-and-schemaorg.html) terminology from the GoodRelations Vocabulary for E-Commerce, created by Martin Hepp. GoodRelations is a data model for sharing e-commerce data on the Web. More information about GoodRelations can be found at [http://purl.org/goodrelations/](http://purl.org/goodrelations/).

sh:property.sh:name: characterName
sh:property.sh:description: The name of a character played in some acting or performing role, i.e. in a PerformanceRole.

sh:property.sh:name: startDate
sh:property.sh:description: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:property.sh:name: roleName
sh:property.sh:description: A role played, performed or filled by a person or organization. For example, the team of creators for a comic book might fill the roles named 'inker', 'penciller', and 'letterer'; or an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

sh:property.sh:name: namedPosition
sh:property.sh:description: A position played, performed or filled by a person or organization, as part of an organization. For example, an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

sh:property.sh:name: endDate
sh:property.sh:description: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Role
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Represents additional information about a relationship or property. For example a Role can be used to say that a 'member' role linking some SportsTeam to a player occurred during a particular time period. Or that a Person's 'actor' role in a Movie was for some particular characterName. Such properties can be attached to a Role entity, which is then associated with the main entities using ordinary properties like 'member' or 'actor'.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/06/introducing-role.html).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Performance role
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A PerformanceRole is a Role that some entity places with regard to a theatrical performance, e.g. in a Movie, TVSeries etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Site navigation element
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A navigation element of the page.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Hair salon
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A hair salon.

sh:property.sh:name: language
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of instrument. The language used on this action.

sh:property.sh:name: inLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Create action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Write action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of authoring written creative content.

schema:DigitalDocumentPermissionType.rdfs:label: Comment permission
schema:DigitalDocumentPermissionType.rdfs:comment: Permission to add comments to the document.

sh:property.sh:name: carrierRequirements
sh:property.sh:description: Specifies specific carrier(s) requirements for the application (e.g. an application may only work on a specific carrier network).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Mobile application
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A software application designed specifically to work well on a mobile device such as a telephone.

sh:property.sh:name: sharedContent
sh:property.sh:description: A CreativeWork such as an image, video, or audio clip shared as part of this posting.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Social media posting
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A post to a social media platform, including blog posts, tweets, Facebook posts, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Discussion forum posting
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A posting to a discussion forum.

sh:property.sh:name: resultComment
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of result. The Comment created or sent as a result of this action.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Reply action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
The act of responding to a question/message asked/sent by the object. Related to [[AskAction]]

Related actions:

* [[AskAction]]: Appears generally as an origin of a ReplyAction.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Quantity
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Quantities such as distance, time, mass, weight, etc. Particular instances of say Mass are entities like '3 Kg' or '4 milligrams'.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Duration
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Quantity: Duration (use [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Paint action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of producing a painting, typically with paint and canvas as instruments.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Taxi
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A taxi.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Taxi service
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A service for a vehicle for hire with a driver for local travel. Fares are usually calculated based on distance traveled.

sh:property.sh:name: salaryCurrency
sh:property.sh:description: The currency (coded using [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) ) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.

sh:property.sh:name: baseSalary
sh:property.sh:description: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

sh:property.sh:name: numberedPosition
sh:property.sh:description: A number associated with a role in an organization, for example, the number on an athlete's jersey.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Organization role
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A subclass of Role used to describe roles within organizations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Employee role
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A subclass of OrganizationRole used to describe employee relationships.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Reservoir
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A reservoir of water, typically an artificially created lake, like the Lake Kariba reservoir.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Entertainment business
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A business providing entertainment.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Night club
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A nightclub or discotheque.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Continent
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: One of the continents (for example, Europe or Africa).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Auto parts store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An auto parts store.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Sculpture
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A piece of sculpture.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Auto wash
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A car wash business.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Automated teller
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: ATM/cash machine.

sh:property.sh:name: volumeNumber
sh:property.sh:description: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".

sh:property.sh:name: pagination
sh:property.sh:description: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

sh:property.sh:name: pageStart
sh:property.sh:description: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

sh:property.sh:name: pageEnd
sh:property.sh:description: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Publication volume
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or multi-volume work, often numbered. It may represent a time span, such as a year.

See also blog post.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Nail salon
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A nail salon.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Subway station
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A subway station.

schema:ActionStatusType.rdfs:label: Completed action status
schema:ActionStatusType.rdfs:comment: An action that has already taken place.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: City
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A city or town.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Beach
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Beach.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Organize action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of manipulating/administering/supervising/controlling one or more objects.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Allocate action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of organizing tasks/objects/events by associating resources to it.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Assign action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of allocating an action/event/task to some destination (someone or something).

schema:RestrictedDiet.rdfs:label: Low calorie diet
schema:RestrictedDiet.rdfs:comment: A diet focused on reduced calorie intake.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Share action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of distributing content to people for their amusement or edification.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Hostel
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A hostel - cheap accommodation, often in shared dormitories.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

sh:property.sh:name: actors
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: directors
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A series of movies. Included movies can be indicated with the hasPart property.

sh:property.sh:name: musicBy
sh:property.sh:description: The composer of the soundtrack.

sh:property.sh:name: trailer
sh:property.sh:description: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: productionCompany
sh:property.sh:description: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Movie series

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Book store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A bookstore.

sh:property.sh:name: subReservation
sh:property.sh:description: The individual reservations included in the package. Typically a repeated property.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Reservation package
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A group of multiple reservations with common values for all sub-reservations.

sh:property.sh:name: occupancy
sh:property.sh:description: The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person). Typical unit code(s): C62 for person

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfRooms
sh:property.sh:description: The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the acccommodation or lodging business. Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

sh:property.sh:name: typeOfBed
sh:property.sh:description: The type of bed to which the BedDetail refers, i.e. the type of bed available in the quantity indicated by quantity.

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfBeds
sh:property.sh:description: The quantity of the given bed type available in the HotelRoom, Suite, House, or Apartment.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Bed details
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An entity holding detailed information about the available bed types, e.g. the quantity of twin beds for a hotel room. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you can use bed directly with a text. See also [[BedType]] (under development).

sh:property.sh:name: bed
sh:property.sh:description: The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text. If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Suite
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A suite in a hotel or other public accommodation, denotes a class of luxury accommodations, the key feature of which is multiple rooms (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suite_(hotel)).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Restaurant
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A restaurant.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Medical organization
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A medical organization (physical or not), such as hospital, institution or clinic.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Dentist
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A dentist.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Casino
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A casino.

schema:PaymentStatusType.rdfs:label: Payment due
schema:PaymentStatusType.rdfs:comment: The payment is due, but still within an acceptable time to be received.

sh:property.sh:name: serviceOperator
sh:property.sh:description: The operating organization, if different from the provider. This enables the representation of services that are provided by an organization, but operated by another organization like a subcontractor.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Government service
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A service provided by a government organization, e.g. food stamps, veterans benefits, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Furniture store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A furniture store.

schema:RestrictedDiet.rdfs:label: Low salt diet
schema:RestrictedDiet.rdfs:comment: A diet focused on reduced sodium intake.

sh:property.sh:name: discusses
sh:property.sh:description: Specifies the CreativeWork associated with the UserComment.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: User comments

sh:property.sh:name: replyToUrl
sh:property.sh:description: The URL at which a reply may be posted to the specified UserComment.

sh:property.sh:name: commentText
sh:property.sh:description: The text of the UserComment.

sh:property.sh:name: creator
sh:property.sh:description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

sh:property.sh:name: commentTime
sh:property.sh:description: The time at which the UserComment was made.

sh:property.sh:name: partOfTVSeries
sh:property.sh:description: The TV series to which this episode or season belongs.

sh:property.sh:name: partOfSeries
sh:property.sh:description: The series to which this episode or season belongs.

sh:property.sh:name: directors
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Clip

sh:property.sh:name: actor
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: clipNumber
sh:property.sh:description: Position of the clip within an ordered group of clips.

sh:property.sh:name: director
sh:property.sh:description: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: partOfEpisode
sh:property.sh:description: The episode to which this clip belongs.

sh:property.sh:name: musicBy
sh:property.sh:description: The composer of the soundtrack.

sh:property.sh:name: actors
sh:property.sh:description: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

sh:property.sh:name: partOfSeason
sh:property.sh:description: The season to which this episode belongs.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A short TV or radio program or a segment/part of a program.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: TVClip
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A short TV program or a segment/part of a TV program.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Boolean
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Boolean: True or False.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Data type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The basic data types such as Integers, Strings, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Travel agency
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A travel agency.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Beauty salon
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Beauty salon.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Government building
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A government building.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Courthouse
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A courthouse.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Literary event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Event type: Literary event.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Sports activity location
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A sports location, such as a playing field.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Ski resort
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A ski resort.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Emergency service
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An emergency service, such as a fire station or ER.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Police station
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A police station.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Mosque
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A mosque.

sh:property.sh:name: borrower
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of participant. The person that borrows the object being lent.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Lend action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
The act of providing an object under an agreement that it will be returned at a later date. Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

Related actions:

* [[BorrowAction]]: Reciprocal of LendAction.

sh:property.sh:name: recipient
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Authorize action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of granting permission to an object.

schema:Organization.rdfs:label: Good relations class
schema:Organization.rdfs:comment: This class is derived from the GoodRelations Vocabulary for E-Commerce, created by Martin Hepp. GoodRelations is a data model for sharing e-commerce data on the Web that can be expressed in a variety of syntaxes, including RDFa and HTML5 Microdata. More information about GoodRelations can be found at [http://purl.org/goodrelations/](http://purl.org/goodrelations/).

schema:Organization.rdfs:label: Bib ex term
schema:Organization.rdfs:comment: The W3C [Schema Bib Extend](http://www.w3.org/community/schemabibex/) (BibEx) group led the work to improve schema.org for bibliographic information, including terms for periodicals, articles and multi-volume works. The design was inspired in places (e.g. [[pageStart]], [[pageEnd]], [[pagination]]) by the [Bibliographic Ontology](http://bibliontology.com/), 'bibo'.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Home goods store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A home goods store.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Shoe store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A shoe store.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Winery
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A winery.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Distance
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Properties that take Distances as values are of the form '<Number> <Length unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 ft'.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Car
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation.

schema:PaymentStatusType.rdfs:label: Payment declined
schema:PaymentStatusType.rdfs:comment: The payee received the payment, but it was declined for some reason.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Canal
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A canal, like the Panama Canal.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Theater group
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A theater group or company, for example, the Royal Shakespeare Company or Druid Theatre.

schema:ItemAvailability.rdfs:label: In stock
schema:ItemAvailability.rdfs:comment: Indicates that the item is in stock.

schema:ItemAvailability.rdfs:label: Limited availability
schema:ItemAvailability.rdfs:comment: Indicates that the item has limited availability.

sh:property.sh:name: hasDigitalDocumentPermission
sh:property.sh:description: A permission related to the access to this document (e.g. permission to read or write an electronic document). For a public document, specify a grantee with an Audience with audienceType equal to "public".

sh:property.sh:name: permissionType
sh:property.sh:description: The type of permission granted the person, organization, or audience.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Digital document permission type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A type of permission which can be granted for accessing a digital document.

sh:property.sh:name: grantee
sh:property.sh:description: The person, organization, contact point, or audience that has been granted this permission.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Digital document permission
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A permission for a particular person or group to access a particular file.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Digital document
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An electronic file or document.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Presentation digital document
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A file containing slides or used for a presentation.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Pharmacy
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A pharmacy or drugstore.

sh:property.sh:name: occupancy
sh:property.sh:description: The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person). Typical unit code(s): C62 for person

sh:property.sh:name: numberOfRooms
sh:property.sh:description: The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the acccommodation or lodging business. Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Apartment
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An apartment (in American English) or flat (in British English) is a self-contained housing unit (a type of residential real estate) that occupies only part of a building (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apartment).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Find action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
The act of finding an object.

Related actions:

* [[SearchAction]]: FindAction is generally lead by a SearchAction, but not necessarily.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Discover action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of discovering/finding an object.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Book series
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A series of books. Included books can be indicated with the hasPart property.

schema:DayOfWeek.rdfs:label: Friday
schema:DayOfWeek.rdfs:comment: The day of the week between Thursday and Saturday.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Search results page
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Web page type: Search results page.

sh:property.sh:name: reportNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The number or other unique designator assigned to a Report by the publishing organization.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Report
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A Report generated by governmental or non-governmental organization.

sh:property.sh:name: educationalRole
sh:property.sh:description: An educationalRole of an EducationalAudience.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Educational audience
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An EducationalAudience.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Home and construction business
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A construction business.

A HomeAndConstructionBusiness is a [[LocalBusiness]] that provides services around homes and buildings.

As a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Locksmith
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A locksmith.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Bookmark action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An agent bookmarks/flags/labels/tags/marks an object.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Tennis complex
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A tennis complex.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: WPSide bar
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A sidebar section of the page.

schema:Organization.rdfs:label: STI Accommodation Ontology
schema:Organization.rdfs:comment: This element is based on the STI Accommodation Ontology, see http://ontologies.sti-innsbruck.at/acco/ns.html for details. Many class and property definitions are inspired by or based on abstracts from Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia.

sh:property.sh:name: opponent
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of participant. The opponent on this action.

sh:property.sh:name: sportsEvent
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of location. The sports event where this action occurred.

sh:property.sh:name: coach
sh:property.sh:description: A person that acts in a coaching role for a sports team.

sh:property.sh:name: athlete
sh:property.sh:description: A person that acts as performing member of a sports team; a player as opposed to a coach.

sh:property.sh:name: sport
sh:property.sh:description: A type of sport (e.g. Baseball).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Sports organization
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Represents the collection of all sports organizations, including sports teams, governing bodies, and sports associations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Sports team
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Organization: Sports team.

sh:property.sh:name: homeTeam
sh:property.sh:description: The home team in a sports event.

sh:property.sh:name: competitor
sh:property.sh:description: A competitor in a sports event.

sh:property.sh:name: awayTeam
sh:property.sh:description: The away team in a sports event.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Sports event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Event type: Sports event.

sh:property.sh:name: toLocation
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

sh:property.sh:name: sportsTeam
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of participant. The sports team that participated on this action.

sh:property.sh:name: event
sh:property.sh:description: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

sh:property.sh:name: audience
sh:property.sh:description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Play action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
The act of playing/exercising/training/performing for enjoyment, leisure, recreation, Competition or exercise.

Related actions:

* [[ListenAction]]: Unlike ListenAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to performing for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming music.
* [[WatchAction]]: Unlike WatchAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to showing/displaying for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming visual content.

sh:property.sh:name: exerciseCourse
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

sh:property.sh:name: fromLocation
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Exercise action

sh:property.sh:name: sportsActivityLocation
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of location. The sports activity location where this action occurred.

sh:property.sh:name: distance
sh:property.sh:description: The distance travelled, e.g. exercising or travelling.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of participating in exertive activity for the purposes of improving health and fitness.

sh:property.sh:name: course
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Sports club
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A sports club.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Camping pitch
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A camping pitch is an individual place for overnight stay in the outdoors, typically being part of a larger camping site.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Hobby shop
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A store that sells materials useful or necessary for various hobbies.

schema:OrderStatus.rdfs:label: Order cancelled
schema:OrderStatus.rdfs:comment: OrderStatus representing cancellation of an order.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Sea body of water
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A sea (for example, the Caspian sea).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: State
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A state or province of a country.

schema:OrderStatus.rdfs:label: Order delivered
schema:OrderStatus.rdfs:comment: OrderStatus representing successful delivery of an order.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Internet cafe
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An internet cafe.

sh:property.sh:name: toLocation
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

sh:property.sh:name: targetCollection
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

sh:property.sh:name: collection
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Update action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of managing by changing/editing the state of the object.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Add action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of editing by adding an object to a collection.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Insert action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of adding at a specific location in an ordered collection.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Append action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of inserting at the end if an ordered collection.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Payment card
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A payment method using a credit, debit, store or other card to associate the payment with an account.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Credit card
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A card payment method of a particular brand or name. Used to mark up a particular payment method and/or the financial product/service that supplies the card account.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#AmericanExpress
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DinersClub
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Discover
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#JCB
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#MasterCard
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#VISA

sh:property.sh:name: expectsAcceptanceOf
sh:property.sh:description: An Offer which must be accepted before the user can perform the Action. For example, the user may need to buy a movie before being able to watch it.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Consume action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of ingesting information/resources/food.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Read action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of consuming written content.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Periodical
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A publication in any medium issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended, such as a magazine, scholarly journal, or newspaper to continue indefinitely.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Shopping center
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A shopping center or mall.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Wholesale store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A wholesale store.

schema:GameServerStatus.rdfs:label: Offline permanently
schema:GameServerStatus.rdfs:comment: Game server status: OfflinePermanently. Server is offline and not available.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Government organization
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A governmental organization or agency.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: City hall
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A city hall.

sh:property.sh:name: priceComponent
sh:property.sh:description: This property links to all [[UnitPriceSpecification]] nodes that apply in parallel for the [[CompoundPriceSpecification]] node.

sh:property.sh:name: unitCode
sh:property.sh:description: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

sh:property.sh:name: billingIncrement
sh:property.sh:description: This property specifies the minimal quantity and rounding increment that will be the basis for the billing. The unit of measurement is specified by the unitCode property.

sh:property.sh:name: referenceQuantity
sh:property.sh:description: The reference quantity for which a certain price applies, e.g. 1 EUR per 4 kWh of electricity. This property is a replacement for unitOfMeasurement for the advanced cases where the price does not relate to a standard unit.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The price asked for a given offer by the respective organization or person.

sh:property.sh:name: unitText
sh:property.sh:description: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Unit price specification

sh:property.sh:name: priceType
sh:property.sh:description: A short text or acronym indicating multiple price specifications for the same offer, e.g. SRP for the suggested retail price or INVOICE for the invoice price, mostly used in the car industry.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Compound price specification
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A compound price specification is one that bundles multiple prices that all apply in combination for different dimensions of consumption. Use the name property of the attached unit price specification for indicating the dimension of a price component (e.g. "electricity" or "final cleaning").

schema:ItemAvailability.rdfs:label: Out of stock
schema:ItemAvailability.rdfs:comment: Indicates that the item is out of stock.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Office equipment store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An office equipment store.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Government permit
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A permit issued by a government agency.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Museum
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A museum.

sh:property.sh:name: endorsee
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Endorse action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An agent approves/certifies/likes/supports/sanction an object.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Social event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Event type: Social event.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Radio clip
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A short radio program or a segment/part of a radio program.

sh:property.sh:name: liveBlogUpdate
sh:property.sh:description: An update to the LiveBlog.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Blog posting
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A blog post.

sh:property.sh:name: coverageStartTime
sh:property.sh:description: The time when the live blog will begin covering the Event. Note that coverage may begin before the Event's start time. The LiveBlogPosting may also be created before coverage begins.

sh:property.sh:name: coverageEndTime
sh:property.sh:description: The time when the live blog will stop covering the Event. Note that coverage may continue after the Event concludes.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Live blog posting
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A blog post intended to provide a rolling textual coverage of an ongoing event through continuous updates.

sh:property.sh:name: providesBroadcastService
sh:property.sh:description: The BroadcastService offered on this channel.

sh:property.sh:name: broadcastChannelId
sh:property.sh:description: The unique address by which the BroadcastService can be identified in a provider lineup. In US, this is typically a number.

sh:property.sh:name: genre
sh:property.sh:description: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A unique instance of a BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

sh:property.sh:name: inBroadcastLineup
sh:property.sh:description: The CableOrSatelliteService offering the channel.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Cable or satellite service
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A service which provides access to media programming like TV or radio. Access may be via cable or satellite.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Broadcast channel

sh:property.sh:name: broadcastServiceTier
sh:property.sh:description: The type of service required to have access to the channel (e.g. Standard or Premium).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Television channel
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A unique instance of a television BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Mass
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Properties that take Mass as values are of the form '<Number> <Mass unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 kg'.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Visual arts event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Event type: Visual arts event.

schema:Organization.rdfs:label: LRMIClass
schema:Organization.rdfs:comment: This class is based on the work of the LRMI project, see lrmi.net for details.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Exercise gym
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A gym.

schema:GameServerStatus.rdfs:label: Online
schema:GameServerStatus.rdfs:comment: Game server status: Online. Server is available.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Department store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A department store.

schema:BoardingPolicyType.rdfs:label: Group boarding policy
schema:BoardingPolicyType.rdfs:comment: The airline boards by groups based on check-in time, priority, etc.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Campground
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A camping site, campsite, or campground is a place used for overnight stay in the outdoors. In British English a campsite is an area, usually divided into a number of pitches, where people can camp overnight using tents or camper vans or caravans; this British English use of the word is synonymous with the American English expression campground. In American English the term campsite generally means an area where an individual, family, group, or military unit can pitch a tent or parks a camper; a campground may contain many campsites (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

sh:property.sh:name: rsvpResponse
sh:property.sh:description: The response (yes, no, maybe) to the RSVP.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Rsvp response type
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: RsvpResponseType is an enumeration type whose instances represent responding to an RSVP request.

sh:property.sh:name: comment
sh:property.sh:description: Comments, typically from users.

sh:property.sh:name: additionalNumberOfGuests
sh:property.sh:description: If responding yes, the number of guests who will attend in addition to the invitee.

sh:property.sh:name: event
sh:property.sh:description: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Inform action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of notifying someone of information pertinent to them, with no expectation of a response.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Rsvp action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of notifying an event organizer as to whether you expect to attend the event.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Accounting service
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Accountancy business.\n\nAs a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Volcano
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A volcano, like Fuji san.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: General contractor
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A general contractor.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Fast food restaurant
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A fast-food restaurant.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Cafe or coffee shop
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A cafe or coffee shop.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: User plus ones
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

sh:property.sh:name: workPresented
sh:property.sh:description: The movie presented during this event.

sh:property.sh:name: videoFormat
sh:property.sh:description: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

sh:property.sh:name: subtitleLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in [IETF BCP 47 standard format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Screening event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A screening of a movie or other video.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Radio station
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A radio station.

sh:property.sh:name: iataCode
sh:property.sh:description: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

sh:property.sh:name: boardingPolicy
sh:property.sh:description: The type of boarding policy used by the airline (e.g. zone-based or group-based).

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Airline
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: An organization that provides flights for passengers.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Synagogue
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A synagogue.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Public swimming pool
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A public swimming pool.

sh:property.sh:name: securityScreening
sh:property.sh:description: The type of security screening the passenger is subject to.

sh:property.sh:name: passengerSequenceNumber
sh:property.sh:description: The passenger's sequence number as assigned by the airline.

sh:property.sh:name: passengerPriorityStatus
sh:property.sh:description: The priority status assigned to a passenger for security or boarding (e.g. FastTrack or Priority).

sh:property.sh:name: boardingGroup
sh:property.sh:description: The airline-specific indicator of boarding order / preference.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Flight reservation
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A reservation for air travel.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

schema:OrderStatus.rdfs:label: Order payment due
schema:OrderStatus.rdfs:comment: OrderStatus representing that payment is due on an order.

sh:property.sh:name: startTime
sh:property.sh:description: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

sh:property.sh:name: partySize
sh:property.sh:description: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

sh:property.sh:name: endTime
sh:property.sh:description: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Food establishment reservation
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A reservation to dine at a food-related business.Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Childrens event
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Event type: Children's event.

sh:property.sh:name: touristType
sh:property.sh:description: Attraction suitable for type(s) of tourist. eg. Children, visitors from a particular country, etc.

sh:property.sh:name: availableLanguage
sh:property.sh:description: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]]

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Tourist attraction
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A tourist attraction. In principle any Thing can be a [[TouristAttraction]], from a [[Mountain]] and [[LandmarksOrHistoricalBuildings]] to a [[LocalBusiness]]. This Type can be used on its own to describe a general [[TourstAttraction]], or be used as an [[additionalType]] to add tourist attraction properties to any other type. (See examples below)

sh:property.sh:name: question
sh:property.sh:description: A sub property of object. A question.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Ask action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
The act of posing a question / favor to someone.

Related actions:

* [[ReplyAction]]: Appears generally as a response to AskAction.

schema:GamePlayMode.rdfs:label: Single player
schema:GamePlayMode.rdfs:comment: Play mode: SinglePlayer. Which is played by a lone player.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Mobile phone store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A store that sells mobile phones and related accessories.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Photograph action
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.

schema:ActionStatusType.rdfs:label: Potential action status
schema:ActionStatusType.rdfs:comment: A description of an action that is supported.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Train reservation
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A reservation for train travel.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Radio season
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: Season dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Room
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A room is a distinguishable space within a structure, usually separated from other spaces by interior walls. (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Room).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Meeting room
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment:
A meeting room, conference room, or conference hall is a room provided for singular events such as business conferences and meetings (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conference_hall).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Library
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A library.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Text digital document
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A file composed primarily of text.

schema:RestrictedDiet.rdfs:label: Diabetic diet
schema:RestrictedDiet.rdfs:comment: A diet appropriate for people with diabetes.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Bowling alley
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A bowling alley.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Jewelry store
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A jewelry store.

sh:NodeShape.rdfs:label: Radio episode
sh:NodeShape.rdfs:comment: A radio episode which can be part of a series or season.

sh:property.sh:name: claimReviewed
